sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余每讀虞書，至於君臣相敕，維是几安，而股肱不良，萬事墮壞，未嘗不流涕也。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: I have often read the Yu Shu, reaching the point where ruler and minister mutually admonish, only then is the state secure, but if the limbs are not good, ten thousand affairs fall into ruin, I have never not shed tears.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Whenever I read the Book of Yu, I always weep when I reach the passage about how ruler and minister must mutually admonish each other for the state to be secure. But if the limbs are not good, then ten thousand affairs fall into ruin.

sentences.zh: 成王作頌，推己懲艾，悲彼家難，可不謂戰戰恐懼，善守善終哉？

translations.literal: Cheng Wang made the Song, pushed himself to punish and reform, grieved those family difficulties, can it not be called trembling with fear, good at guarding and good at ending?
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng composed the Song, reflecting on his own conduct to punish and reform himself. He grieved over those family difficulties—can this not be called trembling with fear, skilled at guarding and skilled at ending?

sentences.zh: 君子不為約則修德，滿則棄禮，佚能思初，安能惟始，沐浴膏澤而歌詠勤苦，非大德誰能如斯！

translations.literal: The gentleman when not constrained then cultivates virtue, when full then abandons ritual, at ease can think of the beginning, secure can remember the start, bathed in rich favor while singing of hardship, who but great virtue can be like this!
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman, when not constrained, cultivates virtue; when full, abandons ritual. In ease he can think of the beginning; in security he can remember the start. Bathed in rich favor, he sings of hardship—who but one of great virtue can be like this!

sentences.zh: 傳曰「治定功成，禮樂乃興」。

translations.literal: The tradition says 'When governance is settled and merit complete, ritual and music then flourish'.
translations.idiomatic: The tradition says: 'When governance is settled and merit complete, ritual and music then flourish.'

sentences.zh: 海內人道益深，其德益至，所樂者益異。

translations.literal: Within the seas human way grew deeper, their virtue grew more complete, what they took joy in grew more refined.
translations.idiomatic: Within the four seas, the human way grew deeper, their virtue grew more complete, and what they took joy in grew more refined.

sentences.zh: 滿而不損則溢，盈而不持則傾。

translations.literal: Full without decrease then overflows, complete without holding then topples.
translations.idiomatic: When full without decrease, it overflows; when complete without holding, it topples.

sentences.zh: 凡作樂者，所以節樂。

translations.literal: All music making is to moderate joy.
translations.idiomatic: All music making is to moderate joy.

sentences.zh: 君子以謙退為禮，以損減為樂，樂其如此也。

translations.literal: The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes decrease and reduction as joy, takes joy in this way.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes decrease and reduction as joy—he takes joy in this way.

sentences.zh: 以為州異國殊，情習不同，故博采風俗，協比聲律，以補短移化，助流政教。

translations.literal: Considering that provinces differ and states vary, feelings and customs differ, thus broadly gather customs, harmonize and compare tones and rhythms, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformation, assist flowing governance and teaching.
translations.idiomatic: Considering that provinces differ and states vary, feelings and customs differ, they thus broadly gather local customs, harmonize and compare tones and rhythms, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformations, assisting the flow of governance and teaching.

sentences.zh: 天子躬於明堂臨觀，而萬民咸蕩滌邪穢，斟酌飽滿，以飾厥性。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven personally at the Bright Hall observes, and the myriad people all wash away evil impurity, ladle full to the brim, to adorn their nature.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven personally observes from the Bright Hall, and the myriad people all wash away evil impurities, ladling full to the brim, to adorn their nature.

sentences.zh: 故云雅頌之音理而民正，嘄噭之聲興而士奮，鄭衛之曲動而心淫。

translations.literal: Thus it is said the sounds of ya and song order and people are correct, the sounds of jiao jiao arise and scholars strive, the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and hearts become licentious.
translations.idiomatic: Thus it is said that the sounds of ya and song bring order and the people are correct; the sounds of jiao jiao arise and scholars strive; the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and hearts become licentious.

sentences.zh: 及其調和諧合，鳥獸盡感，而況懷五常，含好惡，自然之勢也？

translations.literal: When it reaches harmonious blending, birds and beasts all are moved, and moreover those embracing the five constants, containing likes and dislikes, it is the natural tendency.
translations.idiomatic: When it reaches harmonious blending, even birds and beasts are all moved—how much more so those who embrace the five constants and contain likes and dislikes? It is the natural tendency.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: I have often read the Yu Shu, reaching the point where ruler and minister mutually admonish, only then is the state secure, but if the limbs are not good, ten thousand affairs fall into ruin, I have never not shed tears. Cheng Wang made the Song, pushed himself to punish and reform, grieved those family difficulties, can it not be called trembling with fear, good at guarding and good at ending? The gentleman when not constrained then cultivates virtue, when full then abandons ritual, at ease can think of the beginning, secure can remember the start, bathed in rich favor while singing of hardship, who but great virtue can be like this! The tradition says 'When governance is settled and merit complete, ritual and music then flourish'. Within the seas human way grew deeper, their virtue grew more complete, what they took joy in grew more refined. Full without decrease then overflows, complete without holding then topples. All music making is to moderate joy. The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes decrease and reduction as joy, takes joy in this way. Considering that provinces differ and states vary, feelings and customs differ, thus broadly gather customs, harmonize and compare tones and rhythms, to supplement shortcomings and shift transformation, assist flowing governance and teaching. The Son of Heaven personally at the Bright Hall observes, and the myriad people all wash away evil impurity, ladle full to the brim, to adorn their nature. Thus it is said the sounds of ya and song order and people are correct, the sounds of jiao jiao arise and scholars strive, the tunes of Zheng and Wei move and hearts become licentious. When it reaches harmonious blending, birds and beasts all are moved, and moreover those embracing the five constants, containing likes and dislikes, it is the natural tendency.

sentences.zh: 治道虧缺而鄭音興起，封君世辟，名顯鄰州，爭以相高。

translations.literal: When the way of governance is deficient and Zheng music arises, enfeoffed lords generation after generation become powerful, names illustrious in neighboring states, contend to surpass each other.
translations.idiomatic: When the way of governance becomes deficient and Zheng music arises, enfeoffed lords become powerful generation after generation, their names illustrious in neighboring states, contending to surpass each other.

sentences.zh: 自仲尼不能與齊優遂容於魯，雖退正樂以誘世，作五章以剌時，猶莫之化。

translations.literal: Since Zhong Ni could not make the Qi actor tolerate him in Lu, though he retreated to correct music to guide the age, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed.
translations.idiomatic: Since Confucius could not make the Qi actor tolerate him in Lu, though he retired to correct music to guide the age and composed five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed.

sentences.zh: 陵遲以至六國，流沔沈佚，遂往不返，卒於喪身滅宗，并國於秦。

translations.literal: Declining to reach the six states, flowing and sinking in dissipation, went away never to return, finally perished body and extinguished clan, united state to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Decline reached the six states, flowing and sinking in dissipation, going away never to return, finally perishing body and extinguishing clan, uniting the state to Qin.

translations.literal: When the way of governance is deficient and Zheng music arises, enfeoffed lords generation after generation become powerful, names illustrious in neighboring states, contend to surpass each other. Since Zhong Ni could not make the Qi actor tolerate him in Lu, though he retreated to correct music to guide the age, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed. Declining to reach the six states, flowing and sinking in dissipation, went away never to return, finally perished body and extinguished clan, united state to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦二世尤以為娛。

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment.

sentences.zh: 丞相李斯進諫曰：「放棄詩書，極意聲色，祖伊所以懼也；

translations.literal: Chancellor Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandon poetry and books, extreme in sounds and colors, Zu Yi thus feared;
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Li Si advanced a remonstrance saying: 'Abandoning poetry and books, indulging extremely in sounds and colors—this is what Zu Yi feared;

sentences.zh: 輕積細過，恣心長夜，紂所以亡也。」

translations.literal: Lightly accumulate minor faults, indulge heart in long night, Zhou thus perished.'
translations.idiomatic: Lightly accumulating minor faults, indulging the heart in long nights—this is why Zhou perished.'

sentences.zh: 趙高曰：「五帝、三王樂各殊名，示不相襲。

translations.literal: Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors, Three Kings music each had different names, showing they did not imitate each other.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors and Three Kings each had different names for their music, showing they did not imitate each other.

sentences.zh: 上自朝廷，下至人民，得以接歡喜，合殷勤，非此和說不通，解澤不流，亦各一世之化，度時之樂，何必華山之騄耳而後行遠乎？」

translations.literal: Above from the court, below to the people, they can connect joy and happiness, unite attentiveness, not this harmonious delight does not communicate, the dissolving favor does not flow, also each age's transformation, measure of the times' joy, why must it be the Huashan black-eared horse then goes far?'
translations.idiomatic: From the court above to the people below, they can connect joy and happiness, unite in attentiveness. Without this harmonious delight, communication does not flow, and dissolving favor does not spread. Moreover, each age has its own transformation, its own measure of joy for the times—why must it be the Huashan black-eared horse before it can go far?'

sentences.zh: 二世然之。

translations.literal: Er Shi approved it.
translations.idiomatic: Er Shi approved it.

translations.literal: Qin Er Shi especially took it as entertainment. Chancellor Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandon poetry and books, extreme in sounds and colors, Zu Yi thus feared; Lightly accumulate minor faults, indulge heart in long night, Zhou thus perished.' Zhao Gao said: 'The Five Emperors, Three Kings music each had different names, showing they did not imitate each other. Above from the court, below to the people, they can connect joy and happiness, unite attentiveness, not this harmonious delight does not communicate, the dissolving favor does not flow, also each age's transformation, measure of the times' joy, why must it be the Huashan black-eared horse then goes far?' Er Shi approved it.

sentences.zh: 高祖過沛詩三侯之章，令小兒歌之。

translations.literal: Gao Zu passed Pei sang the three marquess chapter, commanded children to sing it.
translations.idiomatic: When Gao Zu passed through Pei, he sang the chapter of the three marquesses and commanded the children to sing it.

sentences.zh: 高祖崩，令沛得以四時歌儛宗廟。

translations.literal: Gao Zu collapsed, commanded Pei to use the four seasons to sing and dance at the ancestral temple.
translations.idiomatic: When Gao Zu passed away, he commanded that Pei be allowed to use the four seasons to sing and dance at the ancestral temple.

sentences.zh: 孝惠、孝文、孝景無所增更，於樂府習常肄舊而已。

translations.literal: Xiao Hui, Xiao Wen, Xiao Jing made no additions or changes, at the Music Bureau practiced the constant and reviewed the old only.
translations.idiomatic: Emperors Hui, Wen, and Jing made no additions or changes; at the Music Bureau they merely practiced the usual and reviewed the old.

translations.literal: Gao Zu passed Pei sang the three marquess chapter, commanded children to sing it. Gao Zu collapsed, commanded Pei to use the four seasons to sing and dance at the ancestral temple. Xiao Hui, Xiao Wen, Xiao Jing made no additions or changes, at the Music Bureau practiced the constant and reviewed the old only.

sentences.zh: 至今上即位，作十九章，令侍中李延年次序其聲，拜為協律都尉。

translations.literal: Until the current emperor ascended the throne, made nineteen chapters, commanded Attendant Li Yan Nian to arrange their sounds, appointed as Harmonious Rhythms Colonel.
translations.idiomatic: Until the current emperor ascended the throne, he composed nineteen chapters, commanded Attendant Li Yannian to arrange their sounds, and appointed him Colonel of Harmonious Rhythms.

sentences.zh: 通一經之士不能獨知其辭，皆集會五經家，相與共講習讀之，乃能通知其意，多爾雅之文。

translations.literal: Those who master one classic cannot alone know its words, all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and practice read it, then can thoroughly understand its meaning, much elegant and correct writing.
translations.idiomatic: Those who master one classic cannot alone understand its words; they all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and practice reading it, then can thoroughly understand its meaning, with much elegant and correct writing.

translations.literal: Until the current emperor ascended the throne, made nineteen chapters, commanded Attendant Li Yan Nian to arrange their sounds, appointed as Harmonious Rhythms Colonel. Those who master one classic cannot alone know its words, all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and practice read it, then can thoroughly understand its meaning, much elegant and correct writing.

sentences.zh: 漢家常以正月上辛祠太一甘泉，以昏時夜祠，到明而終。

translations.literal: Han house constantly in first month upper xin sacrifices Tai Yi at Gan Quan, with dusk time night sacrifice, arrives at dawn and ends.
translations.idiomatic: The Han house constantly sacrifices to Tai Yi at Gan Quan on the upper xin day of the first month, performing the night sacrifice at dusk time, ending when dawn arrives.

sentences.zh: 常有流星經於祠壇上。

translations.literal: Constantly had shooting star pass over the sacrifice altar.
translations.idiomatic: There was constantly a shooting star passing over the sacrificial altar.

sentences.zh: 使僮男僮女七十人俱歌。

translations.literal: Made boy servants and girl servants seventy people all sing together.
translations.idiomatic: He had seventy boy and girl servants all sing together.

sentences.zh: 春歌青陽，夏歌朱明，秋歌西暤，冬歌玄冥。

translations.literal: Spring sings Qing Yang, summer sings Zhu Ming, autumn sings Xi Hai, winter sings Xuan Ming.
translations.idiomatic: In spring they sang Qing Yang; in summer Zhu Ming; in autumn Xi Hai; in winter Xuan Ming.

sentences.zh: 世多有，故不論。

translations.literal: The world has many such, thus not discussed.
translations.idiomatic: The world has many such cases, thus they are not discussed.

translations.literal: Han house constantly in first month upper xin sacrifices Tai Yi at Gan Quan, with dusk time night sacrifice, arrives at dawn and ends. Constantly had shooting star pass over the sacrifice altar. Made boy servants and girl servants seventy people all sing together. Spring sings Qing Yang, summer sings Zhu Ming, autumn sings Xi Hai, winter sings Xuan Ming. The world has many such, thus not discussed.

sentences.zh: 又嘗得神馬渥洼水中，復次以為太一之歌。

translations.literal: Also once obtained divine horse in Wo Wo water, moreover arranged it as Tai Yi song.
translations.idiomatic: He also once obtained a divine horse from the waters of Wo Wo, and moreover arranged it as a song for Tai Yi.

sentences.zh: 歌曲曰：「太一貢兮天馬下，霑赤汗兮沫流赭。

translations.literal: Song lyrics say: 'Tai Yi sends down the heavenly horse, moistens red sweat flows foam crimson.
translations.idiomatic: The song lyrics say: 'Tai Yi sends down the heavenly horse, moist with red sweat, flowing foam crimson.

sentences.zh: 騁容與兮跇萬里，今安匹兮龍為友。」

translations.literal: Gallops at ease crosses ten thousand li, now has companion dragon as friend.'
translations.idiomatic: Gallops at ease, crosses ten thousand li; now finds a companion, dragon as friend.'

sentences.zh: 後伐大宛得千里馬，馬名蒲梢，次作以為歌。

translations.literal: Later attacked Da Yuan obtained thousand li horse, horse named Pu Shao, moreover made it as song.
translations.idiomatic: Later, when attacking Da Yuan, he obtained a thousand-li horse named Pu Shao, and moreover made it into a song.

sentences.zh: 歌詩曰：「天馬來兮從西極，經萬里兮歸有德。

translations.literal: Song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from western extreme, crosses ten thousand li returns to virtuous.
translations.idiomatic: The song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from the western extreme, crosses ten thousand li to return to the virtuous.

sentences.zh: 承靈威兮降外國，涉流沙兮四夷服。」

translations.literal: Receives spiritual might descends foreign lands, crosses flowing sands four barbarians submit.'
translations.idiomatic: Receives spiritual might, descends to foreign lands; crosses flowing sands, the four barbarians submit.'

sentences.zh: 中尉汲黯進曰：「凡王者作樂，上以承祖宗，下以化兆民。

translations.literal: Colonel Ji Pian advanced saying: 'All kings who make music, above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people.
translations.idiomatic: Colonel Ji An advanced saying: 'When kings make music, above they receive the ancestors, below they transform the myriad people.

sentences.zh: 今陛下得馬，詩以為歌，協於宗廟，先帝百姓豈能知其音邪？」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty obtains horse, makes poem as song, harmonizes at ancestral temple, former emperors and people how can they know its sound?'
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty has obtained a horse and made a poem into a song, performed in the ancestral temple—how can the former emperors and the common people know its sound?'

sentences.zh: 上默然不說。

translations.literal: The emperor was silent not pleased.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor was silent and displeased.

sentences.zh: 丞相公孫弘曰：「黯誹謗聖制，當族。」

translations.literal: Chancellor Gong Sun Hong said: 'Pian slanders the sacred system, should be exterminated.'
translations.idiomatic: Chancellor Gongsun Hong said: 'An slanders the sacred system—he should be exterminated.'

translations.literal: Also once obtained divine horse in Wo Wo water, moreover arranged it as Tai Yi song. Song lyrics say: 'Tai Yi sends down the heavenly horse, moistens red sweat flows foam crimson. Gallops at ease crosses ten thousand li, now has companion dragon as friend.' Later attacked Da Yuan obtained thousand li horse, horse named Pu Shao, moreover made it as song. Song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from western extreme, crosses ten thousand li returns to virtuous. Receives spiritual might descends foreign lands, crosses flowing sands four barbarians submit.' Colonel Ji Pian advanced saying: 'All kings who make music, above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people. Now Your Majesty obtains horse, makes poem as song, harmonizes at ancestral temple, former emperors and people how can they know its sound?' The emperor was silent not pleased. Chancellor Gong Sun Hong said: 'Pian slanders the sacred system, should be exterminated.'

sentences.zh: 凡音之起，由人心生也。

translations.literal: All sound arises from the human heart.
translations.idiomatic: All sound arises from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 人心之動，物使之然也。

translations.literal: The human heart's movement, things cause it so.
translations.idiomatic: The movement of the human heart is caused by things.

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，故形於聲；

translations.literal: Moved by things thus takes form in sound;
translations.idiomatic: Moved by things, it takes form in sound;

sentences.zh: 聲相應，故生變；

translations.literal: Sounds respond thus give rise to change;
translations.idiomatic: Sounds respond to each other, thus giving rise to change;

sentences.zh: 變成方，謂之音；

translations.literal: Change becomes pattern, called sound;
translations.idiomatic: Change becomes patterned, called sound;

sentences.zh: 比音而樂之，及干戚羽旄，謂之樂也。

translations.literal: Compare sounds and take joy in them, and with shields axes feathers banners, called music.
translations.idiomatic: Compare sounds and take joy in them, along with shields, axes, feathers, and banners—this is called music.

sentences.zh: 樂者，音之所由生也，其本在人心感於物也。

translations.literal: Music is that from which sound is born, its root is in the human heart moved by things.
translations.idiomatic: Music is that from which sound is born; its root is in the human heart moved by things.

sentences.zh: 是故其哀心感者，其聲噍以殺；

translations.literal: Thus those whose sorrowful heart is moved, their sound is high and sharp;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, those whose sorrowful heart is moved produce sounds that are high and sharp;

sentences.zh: 其樂心感者，其聲啴以緩；

translations.literal: Those whose joyful heart is moved, their sound smooth slow;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose joyful heart is moved produce sounds that are smooth and slow;

sentences.zh: 其喜心感者，其聲發以散；

translations.literal: Those whose happy heart is moved, their sound issue scatter;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose joyful heart is moved produce sounds that issue forth and scatter;

sentences.zh: 其怒心感者，其聲麤以厲；

translations.literal: Those whose angry heart is moved, their sound coarse fierce;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose angry heart is moved produce sounds that are coarse and fierce;

sentences.zh: 其敬心感者，其聲直以廉；

translations.literal: Those whose respectful heart is moved, their sound straight pure;
translations.idiomatic: Those whose respectful heart is moved produce sounds that are straight and pure;

sentences.zh: 其愛心感者，其聲和以柔。

translations.literal: Those whose loving heart is moved, their sound harmonious soft.
translations.idiomatic: Those whose loving heart is moved produce sounds that are harmonious and soft.

sentences.zh: 六者非性也，感於物而後動，是故先王慎所以感之。

translations.literal: Six not nature, moved by things then act, thus former kings careful what move them.
translations.idiomatic: These six emotions are not innate nature; they are moved by external things before they act. Therefore, the former kings were careful about what moved them.

sentences.zh: 故禮以導其志，樂以和其聲，政以壹其行，刑以防其姦。

translations.literal: Thus ritual to guide their will, music to harmonize their sound, governance to unify their conduct, punishment to guard their evil.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, ritual guides their will; music harmonizes their sound; governance unifies their conduct; punishment guards against their evil.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政，其極一也，所以同民心而出治道也。

translations.literal: Ritual music punishment governance, their extreme one, thus same people's hearts and issue governance way.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual, music, punishment, and governance—all reach the same extreme goal, which is to unite the people's hearts and bring forth the way of governance.

translations.literal: All sound arises from the human heart. The human heart's movement, things cause it so. Moved by things thus takes form in sound; Sounds respond thus give rise to change; Change becomes pattern, called sound; Compare sounds and take joy in them, and with shields axes feathers banners, called music. Music is that from which sound is born, its root is in the human heart moved by things. Thus those whose sorrowful heart is moved, their sound is high and sharp; Those whose joyful heart is moved, their sound smooth slow; Those whose happy heart is moved, their sound issue scatter; Those whose angry heart is moved, their sound coarse fierce; Those whose respectful heart is moved, their sound straight pure; Those whose loving heart is moved, their sound harmonious soft. Six not nature, moved by things then act, thus former kings careful what move them. Thus ritual to guide their will, music to harmonize their sound, governance to unify their conduct, punishment to guard their evil. Ritual music punishment governance, their extreme one, thus same people's hearts and issue governance way.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生人心者也。

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart.
translations.idiomatic: All sound is born from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 情動於中，故形於聲，聲成文謂之音。

translations.literal: Feelings move within, thus form in sound, sound forms pattern called sound.
translations.idiomatic: Feelings move within, thus taking form in sound; when sound forms patterns, it is called music.

sentences.zh: 是故治世之音安以樂，其正和；

translations.literal: Thus orderly age sound peaceful joyful, its correct harmony;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the music of a well-ordered age is peaceful and joyful, with proper harmony;

sentences.zh: 亂世之音怨以怒，其正乖；

translations.literal: Chaotic age sound resentful angry, its correct contrary;
translations.idiomatic: The music of a chaotic age is resentful and angry, its harmony contrary;

sentences.zh: 亡國之音哀以思，其民困。

translations.literal: Perished state sound sorrowful thoughtful, its people distressed.
translations.idiomatic: The music of a perished state is sorrowful and thoughtful, its people distressed.

sentences.zh: 聲音之道，與正通矣。

translations.literal: Sound way, with correct connects.
translations.idiomatic: The way of sound connects with what is correct.

sentences.zh: 宮為君，商為臣，角為民，徵為事，羽為物。

translations.literal: Gong for ruler, shang for minister, jue for people, zhi for affairs, yu for things.
translations.idiomatic: Gong represents the ruler; shang the ministers; jue the people; zhi affairs; yu things.

sentences.zh: 五者不亂，則無惉懘之音矣。

translations.literal: Five not chaotic, then no worried sounds.
translations.idiomatic: If these five are not chaotic, then there will be no worried sounds.

sentences.zh: 宮亂則荒，其君驕；

translations.literal: Gong chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant;
translations.idiomatic: When gong is chaotic, it becomes wild, and its ruler arrogant;

sentences.zh: 商亂則搥，其臣壞；

translations.literal: Shang chaotic then strike, its ministers ruined;
translations.idiomatic: When shang is chaotic, it strikes, and its ministers are ruined;

sentences.zh: 角亂則憂，其民怨；

translations.literal: Jue chaotic then worry, its people resentful;
translations.idiomatic: When jue is chaotic, it worries, and its people resentful;

sentences.zh: 徵亂則哀，其事勤；

translations.literal: Zhi chaotic then sorrow, its affairs diligent;
translations.idiomatic: When zhi is chaotic, it sorrows, and its affairs diligent;

sentences.zh: 羽亂則危，其財匱。

translations.literal: Yu chaotic then dangerous, its wealth scarce.
translations.idiomatic: When yu is chaotic, it endangers, and its wealth scarce.

sentences.zh: 五者皆亂，迭相陵，謂之慢。

translations.literal: Five all chaotic, mutually invade, called slow.
translations.idiomatic: When all five are chaotic and mutually invade each other, it is called insolence.

sentences.zh: 如此則國之滅亡無日矣。

translations.literal: Thus then state's extinction no day.
translations.idiomatic: In such a case, the state's extinction will be imminent.

sentences.zh: 鄭衛之音，亂世之音也，比於慢矣。

translations.literal: Zheng Wei sounds, chaotic age sounds, close to slow.
translations.idiomatic: The sounds of Zheng and Wei are the sounds of a chaotic age, bordering on insolence.

sentences.zh: 桑閒濮上之音，亡國之音也，其政散，其民流，誣上行私而不可止。

translations.literal: Sang Jian Pu Shang sounds, perished state sounds, its governance scattered, its people flow, deceive superiors carry private cannot stop.
translations.idiomatic: The sounds from Sang Jian and Pu Shang are the sounds of a perished state: its governance is scattered, its people flow away, deceiving superiors and pursuing private interests cannot be stopped.

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart. Feelings move within, thus form in sound, sound forms pattern called sound. Thus orderly age sound peaceful joyful, its correct harmony; Chaotic age sound resentful angry, its correct contrary; Perished state sound sorrowful thoughtful, its people distressed. Sound way, with correct connects. Gong for ruler, shang for minister, jue for people, zhi for affairs, yu for things. Five not chaotic, then no worried sounds. Gong chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant; Shang chaotic then strike, its ministers ruined; Jue chaotic then worry, its people resentful; Zhi chaotic then sorrow, its affairs diligent; Yu chaotic then dangerous, its wealth scarce. Five all chaotic, mutually invade, called slow. Thus then state's extinction no day. Zheng Wei sounds, chaotic age sounds, close to slow. Sang Jian Pu Shang sounds, perished state sounds, its governance scattered, its people flow, deceive superiors carry private cannot stop.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生於人心者也；

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart;
translations.idiomatic: All sound is born from the human heart;

sentences.zh: 樂者，通於倫理者也。

translations.literal: Music, connects principles ethics.
translations.idiomatic: Music connects with principles and ethics.

sentences.zh: 是故知聲而不知音者，禽獸是也；

translations.literal: Thus know sound not know sound, birds beasts are;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, those who know sound but not music are like birds and beasts;

sentences.zh: 知音而不知樂者，眾庶是也。

translations.literal: Know sound not know music, common people are.
translations.idiomatic: Those who know music but not the essence of music are like the common people.

sentences.zh: 唯君子為能知樂。

translations.literal: Only gentleman can know music.
translations.idiomatic: Only the gentleman can truly understand music.

sentences.zh: 是故審聲以知音，審音以知樂，審樂以知政，而治道備矣。

translations.literal: Thus examine sound to know sound, examine sound to know music, examine music to know governance, governance way complete.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, by examining sounds one can know music; by examining music one can know governance; and thus the way of governance is complete.

sentences.zh: 是故不知聲者不可與言音，不知音者不可與言樂知樂則幾於禮矣。

translations.literal: Thus not know sound cannot speak sound with, not know sound cannot speak music know music then near ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, one who does not know sound cannot discuss music with him; one who does not know music cannot discuss the essence of music with him. Knowing the essence of music brings one close to understanding ritual.

sentences.zh: 禮樂皆得，謂之有德。

translations.literal: Ritual music all obtained, called has virtue.
translations.idiomatic: One who has obtained both ritual and music is called virtuous.

sentences.zh: 德者得也。

translations.literal: Virtue is obtain.
translations.idiomatic: Virtue means having obtained it.

sentences.zh: 是故樂之隆，非極音也；

translations.literal: Thus music's flourishing, not extreme sound;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the flourishing of music is not in extreme sounds;

sentences.zh: 食饗之禮，非極味也。

translations.literal: Feast ritual, not extreme flavor.
translations.idiomatic: The ritual of feasting is not in extreme flavors.

sentences.zh: 清廟之瑟，朱弦而疏越，一倡而三嘆，有遺音者矣。

translations.literal: Clear temple qin, vermilion strings sparse bridges, one lead three sigh, has remaining sound.
translations.idiomatic: The qin of the clear temple has vermilion strings and sparse bridges; one leads and three respond with sighs—there is remaining sound.

sentences.zh: 大饗之禮，尚玄酒而俎腥魚，大羹不和，有遺味者矣。

translations.literal: Great feast ritual, still black wine zu raw fish, great broth not mixed, has remaining flavor.
translations.idiomatic: The ritual of the great feast honors plain wine and raw fish on the stands, with great broth unmixed—there is remaining flavor.

sentences.zh: 是故先王之制禮樂也，非以極口腹耳目之欲也，將以教民平好惡而反人道之正也。

translations.literal: Thus former kings' establish ritual music, not to extreme mouth belly ears eyes desires, will teach people even likes dislikes return human way correct.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when the former kings established ritual and music, it was not to indulge the desires of mouth, belly, ears, and eyes to the extreme. Rather, it was to teach the people to balance their likes and dislikes and return to the correct human way.

translations.literal: All sound, born human heart; Music, connects principles ethics. Thus know sound not know sound, birds beasts are; Know sound not know music, common people are. Only gentleman can know music. Thus examine sound to know sound, examine sound to know music, examine music to know governance, governance way complete. Thus not know sound cannot speak sound with, not know sound cannot speak music know music then near ritual. Ritual music all obtained, called has virtue. Virtue is obtain. Thus music's flourishing, not extreme sound; Feast ritual, not extreme flavor. Clear temple qin, vermilion strings sparse bridges, one lead three sigh, has remaining sound. Great feast ritual, still black wine zu raw fish, great broth not mixed, has remaining flavor. Thus former kings' establish ritual music, not to extreme mouth belly ears eyes desires, will teach people even likes dislikes return human way correct.

sentences.zh: 人生而靜，天之性也；

translations.literal: Human life quiet, heaven's nature;
translations.idiomatic: People are born quiet—this is heaven's nature;

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，性之頌也。

translations.literal: Moved by things act, nature's endowment.
translations.idiomatic: Moved by things and acting—this is the endowment of nature.

sentences.zh: 物至知知，然後好惡形焉。

translations.literal: Things arrive know know, then likes dislikes form.
translations.idiomatic: When things arrive and are known, then likes and dislikes take form.

sentences.zh: 好惡無節於內，知誘於外，不能反己，天理滅矣。

translations.literal: Likes dislikes no measure within, knowledge lured without, cannot return self, heaven principle extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Likes and dislikes have no measure within; knowledge is lured from without; cannot return to the self—heaven's principles are extinguished.

sentences.zh: 夫物之感人無窮，而人之好惡無節，則是物至而人化物也。

translations.literal: Things move people infinite, human likes dislikes no measure, then things arrive human transform things.
translations.idiomatic: Things move people infinitely, yet people's likes and dislikes have no measure—then when things arrive, people are transformed by things.

sentences.zh: 人化物也者，滅天理而窮人欲者也。

translations.literal: Human transform things, extinguish heaven principle exhaust human desires.
translations.idiomatic: When people are transformed by things, they extinguish heaven's principles and exhaust human desires.

sentences.zh: 於是有悖逆詐偽之心，有淫佚作亂之事。

translations.literal: Thus have contrary deceit false heart, have licentious dissipation make chaos affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Then there are hearts of rebellion and deceit; there are affairs of licentious dissipation and chaos-making.

sentences.zh: 是故彊者脅弱，眾者暴寡，知者詐愚，勇者苦怯，疾病不養，老幼孤寡不得其所，此大亂之道也。

translations.literal: Thus strong coerce weak, many violent few, wise deceive foolish, brave oppress cowardly, sickness not nurture, old young orphans widows not get place, this great chaos way.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the strong coerce the weak; the many oppress the few; the wise deceive the foolish; the brave torment the cowardly; the sick are not nurtured; the old, young, orphans, and widows do not get their proper place—this is the way of great chaos.

sentences.zh: 是故先王制禮樂，人為之節：衰麻哭泣，所以節喪紀也；

translations.literal: Thus former kings establish ritual music, human make measure: mourning hemp cry weep, thus measure mourning record;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the former kings established ritual and music to provide measures for people: mourning garments and weeping measure the mourning rituals;

sentences.zh: 鐘鼓干戚，所以和安樂也；

translations.literal: Bells drums shield axe, thus harmonize peaceful joy;
translations.idiomatic: Bells, drums, shields, and axes harmonize peaceful joy;

sentences.zh: 婚姻冠笄，所以別男女也；

translations.literal: Marriage capping and hair-pinning, thus to distinguish male and female;
translations.idiomatic: Marriage ceremonies and capping distinguish male and female;

sentences.zh: 射鄉食饗，所以正交接也。

translations.literal: Archery village feasts, thus to correct intercourse.
translations.idiomatic: Archery contests and village feasts correct social intercourse.

sentences.zh: 禮節民心，樂和民聲，政以行之，刑以防之。

translations.literal: Ritual moderates the people's hearts, music harmonizes the people's sounds, governance to carry it out, punishment to guard against it.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual moderates the people's hearts; music harmonizes the people's sounds. Governance carries them out; punishment guards against violations.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政四達而不悖，則王道備矣。

translations.literal: Ritual music punishment governance four reach without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual, music, punishment, and governance all reach everywhere without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.

translations.literal: Human life quiet, heaven's nature; Moved by things act, nature's endowment. Things arrive know know, then likes dislikes form. Likes dislikes no measure within, knowledge lured without, cannot return self, heaven principle extinguished. Things move people infinite, human likes dislikes no measure, then things arrive human transform things. Human transform things, extinguish heaven principle exhaust human desires. Thus have contrary deceit false heart, have licentious dissipation make chaos affairs. Thus strong coerce weak, many violent few, wise deceive foolish, brave oppress cowardly, sickness not nurture, old young orphans widows not get place, this great chaos way. Thus former kings establish ritual music, human make measure: mourning hemp cry weep, thus measure mourning record; Bells drums shield axe, thus harmonize peaceful joy; Marriage capping and hair-pinning, thus to distinguish male and female; Archery village feasts, thus to correct intercourse. Ritual moderates the people's hearts, music harmonizes the people's sounds, governance to carry it out, punishment to guard against it. Ritual music punishment governance four reach without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.

sentences.zh: 樂者為同，禮者為異。

translations.literal: Music is for sameness, ritual is for difference.
translations.idiomatic: Music creates sameness; ritual creates difference.

sentences.zh: 同則相親，異則相敬。

translations.literal: Same then mutually intimate, different then mutually respectful.
translations.idiomatic: Sameness brings mutual intimacy; difference brings mutual respect.

sentences.zh: 樂勝則流，禮勝則離。

translations.literal: Music prevails then flows, ritual prevails then separates.
translations.idiomatic: When music prevails, it flows; when ritual prevails, it separates.

sentences.zh: 合情飾貌者，禮樂之事也。

translations.literal: Uniting feelings adorning appearance, is ritual music's affair.
translations.idiomatic: Uniting feelings and adorning appearances—these are the affairs of ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 禮義立，則貴賤等矣；

translations.literal: Ritual righteousness established, then noble base equal;
translations.idiomatic: When ritual and righteousness are established, then noble and base have their proper ranks;

sentences.zh: 樂文同，則上下和矣；

translations.literal: Music culture same, then high low harmonize;
translations.idiomatic: When music's culture is the same, then high and low are harmonious;

sentences.zh: 好惡著，則賢不肖別矣；

translations.literal: Likes dislikes manifest, then worthy unworthy distinguished;
translations.idiomatic: When likes and dislikes are manifest, then worthy and unworthy are distinguished;

sentences.zh: 刑禁暴，爵舉賢，則政均矣。

translations.literal: Punishment prohibits violence, rank raises worthy, then governance even.
translations.idiomatic: When punishment prohibits violence and rank raises the worthy, then governance is even.

sentences.zh: 仁以愛之，義以正之，如此則民治行矣。

translations.literal: Benevolence to love them, righteousness to correct them, thus then people governance flows.
translations.idiomatic: Love them with benevolence; correct them with righteousness. Thus, the governance of the people will flow smoothly.

translations.literal: Music is for sameness, ritual is for difference. Same then mutually intimate, different then mutually respectful. Music prevails then flows, ritual prevails then separates. Uniting feelings adorning appearance, is ritual music's affair. Ritual righteousness established, then noble base equal; Music culture same, then high low harmonize; Likes dislikes manifest, then worthy unworthy distinguished; Punishment prohibits violence, rank raises worthy, then governance even. Benevolence to love them, righteousness to correct them, thus then people governance flows.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，禮自外作。

translations.literal: Music comes from within, ritual is made from without.
translations.idiomatic: Music comes from within; ritual is made from without.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，故靜；

translations.literal: Music comes from within, thus quiet;
translations.idiomatic: Music comes from within, therefore it is quiet;

sentences.zh: 禮自外作，故文。

translations.literal: Ritual made from without, thus patterned.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is made from without, therefore it is patterned.

sentences.zh: 大樂必易，大禮必簡。

translations.literal: Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple.
translations.idiomatic: Great music must be easy; great ritual must be simple.

sentences.zh: 樂至則無怨，禮至則不爭。

translations.literal: Music reaches then no resentment, ritual reaches then no contention.
translations.idiomatic: When music reaches its perfection, there is no resentment; when ritual reaches its perfection, there is no contention.

sentences.zh: 揖讓而治天下者，禮樂之謂也。

translations.literal: Yielding and deferring to govern the world, this is called ritual music.
translations.idiomatic: To govern the world through yielding and deferring—this is what is meant by ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 暴民不作，諸侯賓服，兵革不試，五刑不用，百姓無患，天子不怒，如此則樂達矣。

translations.literal: Violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons not tested, five punishments not used, hundred families without worry, Son of Heaven not angry, thus then music reaches completion.
translations.idiomatic: When violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons are not tested, the five punishments are not used, the hundred families have no worries, and the Son of Heaven is not angry—only then does music reach its completion.

sentences.zh: 合父子之親，明長幼之序，以敬四海之內。

translations.literal: Unites father son closeness, clarifies elder younger order, to respect within the four seas.
translations.idiomatic: It unites the closeness of father and son, clarifies the order of elder and younger, to bring respect within the four seas.

sentences.zh: 天子如此，則禮行矣。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven thus, then ritual flows.
translations.idiomatic: When the Son of Heaven acts thus, then ritual flows.

translations.literal: Music comes from within, ritual is made from without. Music comes from within, thus quiet; Ritual made from without, thus patterned. Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple. Music reaches then no resentment, ritual reaches then no contention. Yielding and deferring to govern the world, this is called ritual music. Violent people do not arise, feudal lords submit as guests, weapons not tested, five punishments not used, hundred families without worry, Son of Heaven not angry, thus then music reaches completion. Unites father son closeness, clarifies elder younger order, to respect within the four seas. Son of Heaven thus, then ritual flows.

sentences.zh: 大樂與天地同和，大禮與天地同節。

translations.literal: Great music with heaven earth same harmony, great ritual with heaven earth same measure.
translations.idiomatic: Great music shares the same harmony as heaven and earth; great ritual shares the same measure as heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物不失；

translations.literal: Harmony, thus hundred things not lost;
translations.idiomatic: Because of harmony, the hundred things do not go astray;

sentences.zh: 節，故祀天祭地。

translations.literal: Measure, thus sacrifice heaven worship earth.
translations.idiomatic: Because of measure, one sacrifices to heaven and worships earth.

sentences.zh: 明則有禮樂，幽則有鬼神，如此則四海之內合敬同愛矣。

translations.literal: Bright then has ritual music, dark then has ghosts spirits, thus within four seas united respect same love.
translations.idiomatic: In the bright realm there is ritual and music; in the dark realm there are ghosts and spirits. Thus, within the four seas, respect is united and love is the same.

sentences.zh: 禮者，殊事合敬者也；

translations.literal: Ritual is different affairs united respect;
translations.idiomatic: Ritual unites different affairs in respect;

sentences.zh: 樂者，異文合愛者也。

translations.literal: Music is different patterns united love.
translations.idiomatic: Music unites different patterns in love.

sentences.zh: 禮樂之情同，故明王以相沿也。

translations.literal: Ritual music feelings same, thus enlightened kings mutually continue.
translations.idiomatic: The feelings of ritual and music are the same, therefore enlightened kings mutually continue them.

sentences.zh: 故事與時并，名與功偕。

translations.literal: Thus affairs with time together, name with merit accompany.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, affairs go together with time, names accompany merit.

sentences.zh: 故鐘鼓管磬羽籥干戚，樂之器也；

translations.literal: Thus bells drums pipes chimes feathers yu shields axes, music's instruments;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, bells, drums, pipes, chimes, feathers, yu, shields, and axes—these are music's instruments;

sentences.zh: 詘信俯仰級兆舒疾，樂之文也。

translations.literal: Bend stretch bow rise levels ranks spread hurry, music's patterns.
translations.idiomatic: Bending, stretching, bowing, rising, levels, ranks, spreading, hurrying—these are music's patterns.

sentences.zh: 簠簋俎豆制度文章，禮之器也；

translations.literal: Gui fu zu dou systems patterns, ritual's instruments;
translations.idiomatic: Gui, fu, zu, dou—their systems and patterns—these are ritual's instruments;

sentences.zh: 升降上下周旋裼襲，禮之文也。

translations.literal: Ascend descend high low circle turn bare wear, ritual's patterns.
translations.idiomatic: Ascending, descending, high, low, circling, turning, baring, wearing—these are ritual's patterns.

sentences.zh: 故知禮樂之情者能作，識禮樂之文者能術。

translations.literal: Thus knowing ritual music feelings can create, recognizing ritual music patterns can explain.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, one who knows the feelings of ritual and music can create; one who recognizes the patterns of ritual and music can explain.

sentences.zh: 作者之謂聖，術者之謂明。

translations.literal: Creator called sage, explainer called enlightened.
translations.idiomatic: The creator is called a sage; the explainer is called enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明聖者，術作之謂也。

translations.literal: Enlightened sage is explainer creator called.
translations.idiomatic: The enlightened and sage are those who explain and create.

translations.literal: Great music with heaven earth same harmony, great ritual with heaven earth same measure. Harmony, thus hundred things not lost; Measure, thus sacrifice heaven worship earth. Bright then has ritual music, dark then has ghosts spirits, thus within four seas united respect same love. Ritual is different affairs united respect; Music is different patterns united love. Ritual music feelings same, thus enlightened kings mutually continue. Thus affairs with time together, name with merit accompany. Thus bells drums pipes chimes feathers yu shields axes, music's instruments; Bend stretch bow rise levels ranks spread hurry, music's patterns. Gui fu zu dou systems patterns, ritual's instruments; Ascend descend high low circle turn bare wear, ritual's patterns. Thus knowing ritual music feelings can create, recognizing ritual music patterns can explain. Creator called sage, explainer called enlightened. Enlightened sage is explainer creator called.

sentences.zh: 樂者，天地之和也；

translations.literal: Music is heaven earth's harmony;
translations.idiomatic: Music is the harmony of heaven and earth;

sentences.zh: 禮者，天地之序也。

translations.literal: Ritual is heaven earth's order.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is the order of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物皆化；

translations.literal: Harmony thus hundred things all transform;
translations.idiomatic: Because of harmony, all things are transformed;

sentences.zh: 序，故群物皆別。

translations.literal: Order thus group things all distinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Because of order, all things are distinguished.

sentences.zh: 樂由天作，禮以地制。

translations.literal: Music by heaven made, ritual by earth formed.
translations.idiomatic: Music is made by heaven; ritual is formed by earth.

sentences.zh: 過制則亂，過作則暴。

translations.literal: Exceed formation then chaos, exceed making then violent.
translations.idiomatic: Exceed the formation and there is chaos; exceed the making and there is violence.

sentences.zh: 明於天地，然後能興禮樂也。

translations.literal: Clear about heaven earth, then can flourish ritual music.
translations.idiomatic: Only when clear about heaven and earth can one flourish ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 論倫無患，樂之情也；

translations.literal: Discuss principles without worry, music's feeling;
translations.idiomatic: Discussing principles without worry—this is music's feeling;

sentences.zh: 欣喜驩愛，樂之（容）［官］也。

translations.literal: Joy happiness delight love, music's appearance.
translations.idiomatic: Joy, happiness, delight, love—this is music's appearance.

sentences.zh: 中正無邪，禮之質也；

translations.literal: Central correct without evil, ritual's substance;
translations.idiomatic: Central, correct, without evil—this is ritual's substance;

sentences.zh: 莊敬恭順，禮之制也。

translations.literal: Solemn respectful reverent yielding, ritual's system.
translations.idiomatic: Solemn, respectful, reverent, yielding—this is ritual's system.

sentences.zh: 若夫禮樂之施於金石，越於聲音，用於宗廟社稷，事于山川鬼神，則此所以與民同也。

translations.literal: As for ritual music's application to metal stone, surpasses sounds, used at ancestral temple earth altar, serves mountain rivers ghosts spirits, then this is to unite with people.
translations.idiomatic: As for the application of ritual and music to metal and stone, surpassing mere sounds, used at ancestral temples and earth altars, serving mountains, rivers, ghosts, and spirits—this is what unites with the people.

translations.literal: Music is heaven earth's harmony; Ritual is heaven earth's order. Harmony thus hundred things all transform; Order thus group things all distinguished. Music by heaven made, ritual by earth formed. Exceed formation then chaos, exceed making then violent. Clear about heaven earth, then can flourish ritual music. Discuss principles without worry, music's feeling; Joy happiness delight love, music's appearance. Central correct without evil, ritual's substance; Solemn respectful reverent yielding, ritual's system. As for ritual music's application to metal stone, surpasses sounds, used at ancestral temple earth altar, serves mountain rivers ghosts spirits, then this is to unite with people.

sentences.zh: 王者功成作樂，治定制禮。

translations.literal: Kings when merit complete make music, when governance settled establish ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Kings make music when merit is complete; they establish ritual when governance is settled.

sentences.zh: 其功大者其樂備，其治辨者其禮具。

translations.literal: Merit great then music complete, governance clear then ritual complete.
translations.idiomatic: The greater the merit, the more complete the music; the clearer the governance, the more complete the ritual.

sentences.zh: 干戚之舞，非備樂也；

translations.literal: Shield axe dance, not complete music;
translations.idiomatic: The dance of shields and axes is not complete music;

sentences.zh: 亨孰而祀，非達禮也。

translations.literal: Cook sacrifice, not reach ritual.
translations.idiomatic: To cook and sacrifice is not the ultimate of ritual.

sentences.zh: 五帝殊時，不相沿樂；

translations.literal: Five Emperors different times, not continue music;
translations.idiomatic: The Five Emperors lived in different times and did not continue each other's music;

sentences.zh: 三王異世，不相襲禮。

translations.literal: Three Kings different ages, not imitate ritual.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Kings lived in different ages and did not imitate each other's ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂極則憂，禮粗則偏矣。

translations.literal: Music extreme then worry, ritual crude then partial.
translations.idiomatic: When music reaches its extreme, it turns to worry; when ritual is crude, it becomes partial.

sentences.zh: 及夫敦樂而無憂，禮備而不偏者，其唯大聖乎？

translations.literal: Reach sincere music without worry, ritual complete without partial, its only great sage?
translations.idiomatic: As for those who achieve sincere music without worry and complete ritual without partiality—who but the great sages could do this?

sentences.zh: 天高地下，萬物散殊，而禮制行也；

translations.literal: Heaven high earth low, ten thousand things scattered different, ritual system carries;
translations.idiomatic: Heaven is high, earth is low, the ten thousand things are scattered and different—thus the ritual system is carried out;

sentences.zh: 流而不息，合同而化，而樂興也。

translations.literal: Flows without cease, unites contracts transforms, music arises.
translations.idiomatic: It flows without ceasing, unites and contracts and transforms—thus music arises.

sentences.zh: 春作夏長，仁也；

translations.literal: Spring makes summer grows, benevolence;
translations.idiomatic: Spring creates, summer grows—this is benevolence;

sentences.zh: 秋斂冬藏，義也。

translations.literal: Autumn gathers winter stores, righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Autumn gathers, winter stores—this is righteousness.

sentences.zh: 仁近於樂，義近於禮。

translations.literal: Benevolence close to music, righteousness close to ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Benevolence is close to music; righteousness is close to ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂者敦和，率神而從天；

translations.literal: Music sincere harmony, leads spirits follows heaven;
translations.idiomatic: Music creates sincere harmony; it leads the spirits and follows heaven;

sentences.zh: 禮者辨宜，居鬼而從地。

translations.literal: Ritual distinguishes suitable, dwells ghosts follows earth.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual distinguishes what is suitable; it dwells with ghosts and follows earth.

sentences.zh: 故聖人作樂以應天，作禮以配地。

translations.literal: Thus sages make music to respond heaven, make ritual to match earth.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, sages make music to respond to heaven and make ritual to match earth.

sentences.zh: 禮樂明備，天地官矣。

translations.literal: Ritual music clear complete, heaven earth official.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual and music are clear and complete, heaven and earth are properly served.

translations.literal: Kings when merit complete make music, when governance settled establish ritual. Merit great then music complete, governance clear then ritual complete. Shield axe dance, not complete music; Cook sacrifice, not reach ritual. Five Emperors different times, not continue music; Three Kings different ages, not imitate ritual. Music extreme then worry, ritual crude then partial. Reach sincere music without worry, ritual complete without partial, its only great sage? Heaven high earth low, ten thousand things scattered different, ritual system carries; Flows without cease, unites contracts transforms, music arises. Spring makes summer grows, benevolence; Autumn gathers winter stores, righteousness. Benevolence close to music, righteousness close to ritual. Music sincere harmony, leads spirits follows heaven; Ritual distinguishes suitable, dwells ghosts follows earth. Thus sages make music to respond heaven, make ritual to match earth. Ritual music clear complete, heaven earth official.

sentences.zh: 天尊地卑，君臣定矣。

translations.literal: Heaven honored earth humble, ruler minister settled.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven is honored, earth is humble—thus ruler and minister are settled.

sentences.zh: 高卑已陳，貴賤位矣。

translations.literal: High low already displayed, noble base positioned.
translations.idiomatic: High and low are already displayed; noble and base are positioned.

sentences.zh: 動靜有常，小大殊矣。

translations.literal: Movement stillness have constant, small large different.
translations.idiomatic: Movement and stillness have their constants; small and large are different.

sentences.zh: 方以類聚，物以群分，則性命不同矣。

translations.literal: Directions by kind gather, things by group divide, then life nature different.
translations.idiomatic: Directions gather by kind; things divide by group—thus their natures and destinies are different.

sentences.zh: 在天成象，在地成形，如此則禮者天地之別也。

translations.literal: In heaven forms images, on earth forms shapes, thus ritual heaven earth's distinction.
translations.idiomatic: In heaven it forms images; on earth it forms shapes. Thus ritual is the distinction of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 地氣上隮，天氣下降，陰陽相摩，天地相蕩，鼓之以雷霆，奮之以風雨，動之以四時，煖之以日月，而百［物］化興焉，如此則樂者天地之和也。

translations.literal: Earth qi ascends, heaven qi descends, yin yang mutually rub, heaven earth mutually surge, drums with thunder, rouses with wind rain, moves with four seasons, warms with sun moon, hundred things transform arise, thus music heaven earth's harmony.
translations.idiomatic: Earth qi ascends, heaven qi descends; yin and yang mutually rub, heaven and earth mutually surge. It is drummed by thunder, roused by wind and rain, moved by the four seasons, warmed by sun and moon—and thus the hundred things transform and arise. Such is music, the harmony of heaven and earth.

translations.literal: Heaven honored earth humble, ruler minister settled. High low already displayed, noble base positioned. Movement stillness have constant, small large different. Directions by kind gather, things by group divide, then life nature different. In heaven forms images, on earth forms shapes, thus ritual heaven earth's distinction. Earth qi ascends, heaven qi descends, yin yang mutually rub, heaven earth mutually surge, drums with thunder, rouses with wind rain, moves with four seasons, warms with sun moon, hundred things transform arise, thus music heaven earth's harmony.

sentences.zh: 化不時則不生，男女無別則亂登，此天地之情也。

translations.literal: Transform not timely then not born, male female no distinction then chaos ascends, this heaven earth's feelings.
translations.idiomatic: If transformation is not timely, things are not born; if male and female have no distinction, chaos ascends. This is the feelings of heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 及夫禮樂之極乎天而蟠乎地，行乎陰陽而通乎鬼神，窮高極遠而測深厚，樂著太始而禮居成物。

translations.literal: Reach ritual music's extreme heaven coil earth, walk yin yang connect ghosts spirits, exhaust high extreme far measure deep thick, music manifests great beginning ritual dwells completed things.
translations.idiomatic: As for ritual and music reaching their extreme in heaven and coiling on earth, walking through yin and yang and connecting with ghosts and spirits, exhausting the high and extreme far while measuring the deep and thick—music manifests the great beginning while ritual dwells in completed things.

sentences.zh: 著不息者天也，著不動者地也。

translations.literal: Manifest not cease heaven, manifest not move earth.
translations.idiomatic: That which manifests without ceasing is heaven; that which manifests without moving is earth.

sentences.zh: 一動一靜者，天地之閒也。

translations.literal: One move one still, heaven earth's between.
translations.idiomatic: That which is one movement and one stillness is between heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 故聖人曰「禮云樂云」。

translations.literal: Thus sages say 'ritual cloud music cloud'.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, sages say: 'Ritual is this, music is this.'

translations.literal: Transform not timely then not born, male female no distinction then chaos ascends, this heaven earth's feelings. Reach ritual music's extreme heaven coil earth, walk yin yang connect ghosts spirits, exhaust high extreme far measure deep thick, music manifests great beginning ritual dwells completed things. Manifest not cease heaven, manifest not move earth. One move one still, heaven earth's between. Thus sages say 'ritual cloud music cloud'.

sentences.zh: 昔者舜作五弦之琴，以歌南風；

translations.literal: Former Shun made five string qin, to sing southern wind;
translations.idiomatic: In former times, Shun made a five-string qin to sing of the southern wind;

sentences.zh: 夔始作樂，以賞諸侯。

translations.literal: Kui first made music, to reward feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Kui first made music to reward the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 故天子之為樂也，以賞諸侯之有德者也。

translations.literal: Thus Son of Heaven makes music, to reward feudal lords who have virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when the Son of Heaven makes music, it is to reward feudal lords who have virtue.

sentences.zh: 德盛而教尊，五穀時孰，然後賞之以樂。

translations.literal: Virtue flourishing teaching honored, five grains timely ripe, then reward with music.
translations.idiomatic: When virtue flourishes and teaching is honored, when the five grains ripen in season, only then reward them with music.

sentences.zh: 故其治民勞者，其舞行級遠；

translations.literal: Thus govern people toil, their dance steps grade far;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when governing people who toil, their dance steps are graded far;

sentences.zh: 其治民佚者，其舞行級短。

translations.literal: Govern people ease, their dance steps grade short.
translations.idiomatic: When governing people at ease, their dance steps are graded short.

sentences.zh: 故觀其舞而知其德，聞其謚而知其行。

translations.literal: Thus observe dance know virtue, hear posthumous know conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, by observing their dance you know their virtue; by hearing their posthumous name you know their conduct.

sentences.zh: 大章，章之也；

translations.literal: Great Zhang, zhang it;
translations.idiomatic: Da Zhang means to display it;

sentences.zh: 咸池，備也；

translations.literal: Xian Chi, complete;
translations.idiomatic: Xian Chi means complete;

sentences.zh: 韶，繼也；

translations.literal: Shao, continue;
translations.idiomatic: Shao means to continue;

sentences.zh: 夏，大也；

translations.literal: Xia, great;
translations.idiomatic: Xia means great;

sentences.zh: 殷周之樂盡也。

translations.literal: Yin Zhou music exhaust.
translations.idiomatic: The music of Yin and Zhou reaches its exhaustion.

translations.literal: Former Shun made five string qin, to sing southern wind; Kui first made music, to reward feudal lords. Thus Son of Heaven makes music, to reward feudal lords who have virtue. Virtue flourishing teaching honored, five grains timely ripe, then reward with music. Thus govern people toil, their dance steps grade far; Govern people ease, their dance steps grade short. Thus observe dance know virtue, hear posthumous know conduct. Great Zhang, zhang it; Xian Chi, complete; Shao, continue; Xia, great; Yin Zhou music exhaust.

sentences.zh: 天地之道，寒暑不時則疾，風雨不節則饑。

translations.literal: Heaven earth's way, cold heat not timely then illness, wind rain not measure then famine.
translations.idiomatic: The way of heaven and earth: if cold and heat are not timely, there is illness; if wind and rain are not measured, there is famine.

sentences.zh: 教者，民之寒暑也，教不時則傷世。

translations.literal: Teaching, people's cold heat, teaching not timely then harm age.
translations.idiomatic: Teaching is the cold and heat for the people; if teaching is not timely, it harms the age.

sentences.zh: 事者，民之風雨也，事不節則無功。

translations.literal: Affairs, people's wind rain, affairs not measure then no merit.
translations.idiomatic: Affairs are the wind and rain for the people; if affairs are not measured, there is no merit.

sentences.zh: 然則先王之為樂也，以法治也，善則行象德矣。

translations.literal: Thus then former kings make music, with law governs, good then conduct symbolizes virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when the former kings made music, they used it to govern with law; when good, conduct symbolizes virtue.

sentences.zh: 夫豢豕為酒，非以為禍也；

translations.literal: Raise pigs for wine, not for calamity;
translations.idiomatic: Raising pigs to make wine is not meant to create calamity;

sentences.zh: 而獄訟益煩，則酒之流生禍也。

translations.literal: But lawsuits increasingly frequent, then wine flow gives birth calamity.
translations.idiomatic: But when lawsuits become increasingly frequent, then the flow of wine gives birth to calamity.

sentences.zh: 是故先王因為酒禮，一獻之禮，賓主百拜，終日飲酒而不得醉焉，此先王之所以備酒禍也。

translations.literal: Thus former kings because wine ritual, one offering ritual, guest host hundred bows, end day drink wine not get drunk, this former kings prepare wine calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the former kings established wine rituals: the ritual of one offering, where guest and host exchange a hundred bows, drinking wine all day without getting drunk—this is how the former kings prepared against wine's calamities.

sentences.zh: 故酒食者，所以合歡也。

translations.literal: Thus wine food, to unite joy.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, wine and food serve to unite joy.

translations.literal: Heaven earth's way, cold heat not timely then illness, wind rain not measure then famine. Teaching, people's cold heat, teaching not timely then harm age. Affairs, people's wind rain, affairs not measure then no merit. Thus then former kings make music, with law governs, good then conduct symbolizes virtue. Raise pigs for wine, not for calamity; But lawsuits increasingly frequent, then wine flow gives birth calamity. Thus former kings because wine ritual, one offering ritual, guest host hundred bows, end day drink wine not get drunk, this former kings prepare wine calamity. Thus wine food, to unite joy.

sentences.zh: 樂者，所以象德也；

translations.literal: Music, to symbolize virtue;
translations.idiomatic: Music serves to symbolize virtue;

sentences.zh: 禮者，所以閉淫也。

translations.literal: Ritual, to close licentious.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual serves to close off licentiousness.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有大事，必有禮以哀之；

translations.literal: Thus former kings have great affairs, must have ritual to mourn them;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when the former kings had great affairs, they must have ritual to mourn them;

sentences.zh: 有大福，必有禮以樂之：哀樂之分，皆以禮終。

translations.literal: Have great blessing, must have ritual to take joy in it: joy sorrow divisions, all with ritual end.
translations.idiomatic: When they had great blessings, they must have ritual to take joy in them: the divisions of sorrow and joy all end with ritual.

translations.literal: Music, to symbolize virtue; Ritual, to close licentious. Thus former kings have great affairs, must have ritual to mourn them; Have great blessing, must have ritual to take joy in it: joy sorrow divisions, all with ritual end.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，施也；

translations.literal: Music is giving;
translations.idiomatic: Music is giving;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，報也。

translations.literal: Ritual is receiving.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is reciprocity.

sentences.zh: 樂，樂其所自生；

translations.literal: Music, takes joy in what gives birth to it;
translations.idiomatic: Music takes joy in what gives birth to it;

sentences.zh: 而禮，反其所自始。

translations.literal: Ritual returns to what begins it.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual returns to what begins it.

sentences.zh: 樂章德，禮報情反始也。

translations.literal: Music displays virtue, ritual repays feeling returns to beginning.
translations.idiomatic: Music displays virtue; ritual repays feeling and returns to the beginning.

sentences.zh: 所謂大路者，天子之輿也；

translations.literal: What is called great carriage, is the Son of Heaven's chariot;
translations.idiomatic: What is called the great chariot is the Son of Heaven's carriage;

sentences.zh: 龍旂九旒，天子之旌也；

translations.literal: Dragon banner nine tassels, is the Son of Heaven's standard;
translations.idiomatic: The dragon banner with nine tassels is the Son of Heaven's standard;

sentences.zh: 青黑緣者，天子之葆龜也；

translations.literal: Blue black edged, is the Son of Heaven's canopy turtle;
translations.idiomatic: The blue-black edged one is the Son of Heaven's canopy turtle;

sentences.zh: 從之以牛羊之群，則所以贈諸侯也。

translations.literal: Followed by herds of cattle sheep, then this is to gift feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Followed by herds of cattle and sheep, this is for gifting to the feudal lords.

translations.literal: Music is giving; Ritual is receiving. Music, takes joy in what gives birth to it; Ritual returns to what begins it. Music displays virtue, ritual repays feeling returns to beginning. What is called great carriage, is the Son of Heaven's chariot; Dragon banner nine tassels, is the Son of Heaven's standard; Blue black edged, is the Son of Heaven's canopy turtle; Followed by herds of cattle sheep, then this is to gift feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，情之不可變者也；

translations.literal: Music is feelings that cannot be changed;
translations.idiomatic: Music is the feelings that cannot be changed;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，理之不可易者也。

translations.literal: Ritual is principles that cannot be altered.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is the principles that cannot be altered.

sentences.zh: 樂統同，禮別異，禮樂之說貫乎人情矣。

translations.literal: Music unites sameness, ritual distinguishes difference, ritual music's explanation penetrates human feelings.
translations.idiomatic: Music unites what is the same; ritual distinguishes what is different. The explanation of ritual and music penetrates human feelings.

sentences.zh: 窮本知變，樂之情也；

translations.literal: Exhaust root know change, music's feeling;
translations.idiomatic: To exhaust the root and know change is music's feeling;

sentences.zh: 著誠去偽，禮之經也。

translations.literal: Manifest sincerity remove falsity, ritual's constant.
translations.idiomatic: To manifest sincerity and remove falsity is ritual's constant.

sentences.zh: 禮樂順天地之誠，達神明之德，降興上下之神，而凝是精粗之體，領父子君臣之節。

translations.literal: Ritual music follows heaven earth's sincerity, reaches spirits' virtue, descends raises high low spirits, and congeals refined coarse bodies, leads father son ruler minister measures.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual and music follow heaven and earth's sincerity, reach the spirits' virtue, descend and raise the high and low spirits, and congeal the refined and coarse bodies, leading the measures of father and son, ruler and minister.

translations.literal: Music is feelings that cannot be changed; Ritual is principles that cannot be altered. Music unites sameness, ritual distinguishes difference, ritual music's explanation penetrates human feelings. Exhaust root know change, music's feeling; Manifest sincerity remove falsity, ritual's constant. Ritual music follows heaven earth's sincerity, reaches spirits' virtue, descends raises high low spirits, and congeals refined coarse bodies, leads father son ruler minister measures.

sentences.zh: 是故大人舉禮樂，則天地將為昭焉。

translations.literal: Thus great person raises ritual music, then heaven earth will become bright.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when the great person upholds ritual and music, heaven and earth will become bright.

sentences.zh: 天地欣合，陰陽相得，煦嫗覆育萬物，然後草木茂，區萌達，羽翮奮，角觡生，蟄蟲昭穌，羽者嫗伏，毛者孕鬻，胎生者不殰而卵生者不殈，則樂之道歸焉耳。

translations.literal: Heaven earth joyful unite, yin yang mutually obtain, warm nurture cover nourish ten thousand things, then grass trees flourish, regions sprout reach, feathered winged strive, horned tusked born, hibernating insects appear crawl, feathered warm brood, furred pregnant produce, womb born not abort egg born not break, then music's way returns there.
translations.idiomatic: When heaven and earth joyfully unite, yin and yang mutually obtain each other, warming and nurturing, covering and nourishing the ten thousand things—then grass and trees flourish, regions sprout and reach, feathered and winged strive, horned and tusked are born, hibernating insects appear and crawl, feathered ones warm and brood, furred ones are pregnant and produce, womb-born do not abort and egg-born do not break—then the way of music returns there.

translations.literal: Thus great person raises ritual music, then heaven earth will become bright. Heaven earth joyful unite, yin yang mutually obtain, warm nurture cover nourish ten thousand things, then grass trees flourish, regions sprout reach, feathered winged strive, horned tusked born, hibernating insects appear crawl, feathered warm brood, furred pregnant produce, womb born not abort egg born not break, then music's way returns there.

sentences.zh: 樂者，非謂黃鐘大呂弦歌干揚也，樂之末節也，故童者舞之；

translations.literal: Music, not meaning yellow bell great lu string song shield axe, music's minor section, thus children dance it;
translations.idiomatic: Music does not mean the yellow bell and great lu, string songs and shield axes—these are music's minor sections, thus children dance to them;

sentences.zh: 布筵席，陳樽俎，列籩豆，以升降為禮者，禮之末節也，故有司掌之。

translations.literal: Spread mats seats, arrange zun zu, arrange ban dou, with ascending descending as ritual, ritual's minor section, thus officials manage it.
translations.idiomatic: Spreading mats and seats, arranging zun and zu, arranging ban and dou, taking ascending and descending as ritual—these are ritual's minor sections, thus officials manage them.

sentences.zh: 樂師辯乎聲詩，故北面而弦；

translations.literal: Music master distinguishes sounds poems, thus north facing strings;
translations.idiomatic: The music master distinguishes sounds and poems, thus facing north to play the strings;

sentences.zh: 宗祝辯乎宗廟之禮，故後尸；

translations.literal: Ancestral priest distinguishes ancestral temple ritual, thus behind corpse;
translations.idiomatic: The ancestral priest distinguishes the ancestral temple rituals, thus standing behind the corpse;

sentences.zh: 商祝辯乎喪禮，故後主人。

translations.literal: Funeral priest distinguishes mourning ritual, thus behind master.
translations.idiomatic: The funeral priest distinguishes the mourning rituals, thus standing behind the master.

sentences.zh: 是故德成而上，藝成而下；

translations.literal: Thus virtue complete then above, skill complete then below;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when virtue is complete, it is above; when skill is complete, it is below;

sentences.zh: 行成而先，事成而後。

translations.literal: Conduct complete then first, affairs complete then after.
translations.idiomatic: When conduct is complete, it is first; when affairs are complete, they are after.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有上有下，有先有後，然後可以有制於天下也。

translations.literal: Thus former kings have above below, have first after, then can have system over the world.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the former kings had above and below, had first and after, then they could have a system over the world.

translations.literal: Music, not meaning yellow bell great lu string song shield axe, music's minor section, thus children dance it; Spread mats seats, arrange zun zu, arrange ban dou, with ascending descending as ritual, ritual's minor section, thus officials manage it. Music master distinguishes sounds poems, thus north facing strings; Ancestral priest distinguishes ancestral temple ritual, thus behind corpse; Funeral priest distinguishes mourning ritual, thus behind master. Thus virtue complete then above, skill complete then below; Conduct complete then first, affairs complete then after. Thus former kings have above below, have first after, then can have system over the world.

sentences.zh: 樂者，聖人之所樂也，而可以善民心。

translations.literal: Music is what sages take joy in, and can improve people's hearts.
translations.idiomatic: Music is what sages take joy in, and it can improve people's hearts.

sentences.zh: 其感人深，其風移俗易，故先王著其教焉。

translations.literal: Its moving people deep, its wind shifts customs easy, thus former kings established its teaching.
translations.idiomatic: Its influence on people is deep, its wind shifts customs easily, thus the former kings established its teaching.

translations.literal: Music is what sages take joy in, and can improve people's hearts. Its moving people deep, its wind shifts customs easy, thus former kings established its teaching.

sentences.zh: 夫人有血氣心知之性，而無哀樂喜怒之常，應感起物而動，然後心術形焉。

translations.literal: People have blood qi heart knowing nature, but no joy sorrow happiness anger constants, respond to stimulation arise from things and move, then heart methods take form.
translations.idiomatic: People have a nature of blood qi and heart knowing, but no constants of joy, sorrow, happiness, and anger; they respond to stimulation, arise from things and move, then the methods of the heart take form.

sentences.zh: 是故志微焦衰之音作，而民思憂；

translations.literal: Thus subtle withered declining sounds made, and people think worry;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when sounds of subtle, withered, and declining will are made, the people think of worry;

sentences.zh: 啴緩慢易繁文簡節之音作，而民康樂；

translations.literal: Smooth slow easy elaborate patterned simple sectioned sounds made, and people peaceful joyful;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of smooth, slow, easy, elaborate patterned, and simple sectioned are made, the people are peaceful and joyful;

sentences.zh: 粗厲猛起奮末廣賁之音作，而民剛毅；

translations.literal: Coarse fierce violent rising striving end broad flourishing sounds made, and people firm resolute;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of coarse, fierce, violent rising, striving end, broad, and flourishing are made, the people are firm and resolute;

sentences.zh: 廉直經正莊誠之音作，而民肅敬；

translations.literal: Pure straight upright correct solemn sincere sounds made, and people solemn respectful;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of pure, straight, upright, correct, solemn, and sincere are made, the people are solemn and respectful;

sentences.zh: 寬裕肉好順成和動之音作，而民慈愛；

translations.literal: Broad ample fleshy good yielding formed harmonious moving sounds made, and people benevolent loving;
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of broad, ample, fleshy, good, yielding, formed, harmonious, and moving are made, the people are benevolent and loving;

sentences.zh: 流辟邪散狄成滌濫之音作，而民淫亂。

translations.literal: Flowing deviant evil scattered foreign formed washed overflowing sounds made, and people licentious chaotic.
translations.idiomatic: When sounds of flowing, deviant, evil, scattered, foreign, formed, washed, and overflowing are made, the people become licentious and chaotic.

translations.literal: People have blood qi heart knowing nature, but no joy sorrow happiness anger constants, respond to stimulation arise from things and move, then heart methods take form. Thus subtle withered declining sounds made, and people think worry; Smooth slow easy elaborate patterned simple sectioned sounds made, and people peaceful joyful; Coarse fierce violent rising striving end broad flourishing sounds made, and people firm resolute; Pure straight upright correct solemn sincere sounds made, and people solemn respectful; Broad ample fleshy good yielding formed harmonious moving sounds made, and people benevolent loving; Flowing deviant evil scattered foreign formed washed overflowing sounds made, and people licentious chaotic.

sentences.zh: 是故先王本之情性，稽之度數，制之禮義，合生氣之和，道五常之行，使之陽而不散，陰而不密，剛氣不怒，柔氣不懾，四暢交於中而發作於外，皆安其位而不相奪也。

translations.literal: Thus former kings based on feelings nature, examined measurements numbers, formed ritual righteousness, united vital energy harmony, guided five constants conduct, made yang without scattering, yin without dense, firm qi not angry, soft qi not frightened, four flourishing intersect at center and issue at outside, all settle their positions without mutually seizing.
