translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the former kings based them on the nature of feelings, examined them by measurements and numbers, formed them by ritual and righteousness, united the harmony of vital energy, guided the conduct of the five constants, made yang without scattering, yin without density, firm qi not angry, soft qi not frightened, the four flourishing intersect at the center and issue at the outside, all settling their positions without mutually seizing.

sentences.zh: 然後立之學等，廣其節奏，省其文采，以繩德厚也。

translations.literal: Then established study grades, broadened rhythm, simplified patterns colors, to rope virtue thickness.
translations.idiomatic: Then they established study grades, broadened their rhythms, simplified their patterns and colors, to rope the thickness of virtue.

sentences.zh: 類小大之稱，比終始之序，以象事行，使親疏貴賤長幼男女之理皆形見於樂：故曰「樂觀其深矣」。

translations.literal: Classify small large proportions, compare end beginning order, to symbolize affairs conduct, make close distant noble base elder younger male female principles all appear in music: thus said 'music observe its deep'.
translations.idiomatic: Classifying the proportions of small and large, comparing the order of end and beginning, to symbolize affairs and conduct, making the principles of close and distant, noble and base, elder and younger, male and female all visibly appear in music: thus it is said, 'Music observes its deep.'

translations.literal: Thus former kings based on feelings nature, examined measurements numbers, formed ritual righteousness, united vital energy harmony, guided five constants conduct, made yang without scattering, yin without dense, firm qi not angry, soft qi not frightened, four flourishing intersect at center and issue at outside, all settle their positions without mutually seizing. Then established study grades, broadened rhythm, simplified patterns colors, to rope virtue thickness. Classify small large proportions, compare end beginning order, to symbolize affairs conduct, make close distant noble base elder younger male female principles all appear in music: thus said 'music observe its deep'.

sentences.zh: 土敝則草木不長，水煩則魚鱉不大，氣衰則生物不育，世亂則禮廢而樂淫。

translations.literal: Soil exhausted then grass trees not grow, water troubled then fish turtles not big, qi declined then living things not nurture, age chaotic then ritual waste and music licentious.
translations.idiomatic: When soil is exhausted, grass and trees do not grow; when water is troubled, fish and turtles do not grow big; when qi declines, living things are not nurtured; when the age is chaotic, ritual is wasted and music becomes licentious.

sentences.zh: 是故其聲哀而不莊，樂而不安，慢易以犯節，流湎以忘本。

translations.literal: Thus its sounds mournful without solemnity, joyful without peace, casual easy to violate sections, flowing drowning to forget root.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, its sounds are mournful but not solemn, joyful but not peaceful, casual and easy to violate the sections, flowing and drowning to forget the root.

sentences.zh: 廣則容姦。

translations.literal: Broad then contains evil.
translations.idiomatic: If broad, it contains evil.

sentences.zh: 狹則思欲，感滌蕩之氣而滅平和之德，是以君子賤之也。

translations.literal: Narrow then desires, affected by washed wandering qi and extinguish peaceful virtue, thus gentlemen despise it.
translations.idiomatic: If narrow, it arouses desires; affected by washed and wandering qi, it extinguishes peaceful virtue—thus gentlemen despise it.

translations.literal: Soil exhausted then grass trees not grow, water troubled then fish turtles not big, qi declined then living things not nurture, age chaotic then ritual waste and music licentious. Thus its sounds mournful without solemnity, joyful without peace, casual easy to violate sections, flowing drowning to forget root. Broad then contains evil. Narrow then desires, affected by washed wandering qi and extinguish peaceful virtue, thus gentlemen despise it.

sentences.zh: 凡姦聲感人而逆氣應之，逆氣成象而淫樂興焉。

translations.literal: All evil sounds move people and adverse qi respond to them, adverse qi forms images and licentious music arises.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever evil sounds move people, adverse qi responds to them; adverse qi forms images and licentious music arises.

sentences.zh: 正聲感人而順氣應之，順氣成象而和樂興焉。

translations.literal: Correct sounds move people and yielding qi respond to them, yielding qi forms images and harmonious music arises.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever correct sounds move people, yielding qi responds to them; yielding qi forms images and harmonious music arises.

sentences.zh: 倡和有應，回邪曲直各歸其分，而萬物之理以類相動也。

translations.literal: Leader harmony have response, returning deviant curved straight each return to their division, and ten thousand things principle with kind mutually move.
translations.idiomatic: Leader and harmony have responses; returning evil and curving straight each return to their divisions, and the principles of the ten thousand things move each other by kind.

translations.literal: All evil sounds move people and adverse qi respond to them, adverse qi forms images and licentious music arises. Correct sounds move people and yielding qi respond to them, yielding qi forms images and harmonious music arises. Leader harmony have response, returning deviant curved straight each return to their division, and ten thousand things principle with kind mutually move.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，比類以成其行。

translations.literal: Thus gentleman returns to feeling to harmonize will, compares kinds to complete conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the gentleman returns to feelings to harmonize his will, compares kinds to complete his conduct.

sentences.zh: 姦聲亂色不留聰明，淫樂廢禮不接於心術，惰慢邪辟之氣不設於身體，使耳目鼻口心知百體皆由順正，以行其義。

translations.literal: Evil sounds chaotic colors not stay intelligence, licentious music wastes ritual not connect to heart methods, lazy slow deviant crooked qi not placed in body, make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred bodies all follow upright correct, to carry out their righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Evil sounds and chaotic colors do not stay in intelligence; licentious music wastes ritual and does not connect to heart methods; lazy, slow, deviant, and crooked qi are not placed in the body, making ears, eyes, nose, mouth, heart knowing, and the hundred bodies all follow upright and correct, to carry out their righteousness.

sentences.zh: 然後發以聲音，文以琴瑟，動以干戚，飾以羽旄，從以簫管，奮至德之光，動四氣之和，以著萬物之理。

translations.literal: Then issue with sounds, pattern with qin se, move with shield axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with xiao pipes, strive utmost virtue light, move four qi harmony, to manifest ten thousand things principle.
translations.idiomatic: Then issue with sounds, pattern with qin and se, move with shield and axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with xiao pipes, strive the light of utmost virtue, move the harmony of the four qi, to manifest the principles of the ten thousand things.

sentences.zh: 是故清明象天，廣大象地，終始象四時，周旋象風雨；

translations.literal: Thus clear bright symbolizes heaven, vast symbolizes earth, end beginning symbolizes four seasons, circling symbolizes wind rain;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, clear and bright symbolizes heaven, vast symbolizes earth, end and beginning symbolize the four seasons, circling symbolizes wind and rain;

sentences.zh: 五色成文而不亂，八風從律而不姦，百度得數而有常；

translations.literal: Five colors form pattern without chaos, eight winds follow pitch without evil, hundred measures obtain number have constant;
translations.idiomatic: Five colors form pattern without chaos, eight winds follow the pitch without evil, the hundred measures obtain numbers and have constants;

sentences.zh: 小大相成，終始相生，倡和清濁，代相為經。

translations.literal: Small large mutually complete, end beginning mutually born, lead harmony clear turbid, alternate mutually as warp.
translations.idiomatic: Small and large mutually complete, end and beginning mutually born, leader and harmony, clear and turbid alternate mutually as warp.

sentences.zh: 故樂行而倫清，耳目聰明，血氣和平，移風易俗，天下皆寧。

translations.literal: Thus music carries principles clear, ears eyes intelligent, blood qi peaceful, shift customs change habits, world all peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when music flows, principles are clear; ears and eyes are intelligent, blood and qi peaceful, customs are shifted and habits changed, the world is all peaceful.

sentences.zh: 故曰「樂者樂也」。

translations.literal: Thus said 'music joy'.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: 'Music is joy.'

sentences.zh: 君子樂得其道，小人樂得其欲。

translations.literal: Gentleman joy gets way, small person joy gets desires.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman takes joy in getting the Way; the small person takes joy in getting desires.

sentences.zh: 以道制欲，則樂而不亂；

translations.literal: With way control desires, then joy without chaos;
translations.idiomatic: Using the Way to control desires, then joy without chaos;

sentences.zh: 以欲忘道，則惑而不樂。

translations.literal: With desires forget way, then confused without joy.
translations.idiomatic: Using desires to forget the Way, then confused without joy.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，廣樂以成其教，樂行而民鄉方，可以觀德矣。

translations.literal: Thus gentleman returns to feeling harmonize will, broadens joy completes teaching, music carries people turn to square, can observe virtue.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the gentleman returns to feelings to harmonize his will, broadens joy to complete his teaching; when music flows, the people turn toward rectitude—one can observe virtue.

translations.literal: Thus gentleman returns to feeling to harmonize will, compares kinds to complete conduct. Evil sounds chaotic colors not stay intelligence, licentious music wastes ritual not connect to heart methods, lazy slow deviant crooked qi not placed in body, make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred bodies all follow upright correct, to carry out their righteousness. Then issue with sounds, pattern with qin se, move with shield axe, adorn with feather banners, follow with xiao pipes, strive utmost virtue light, move four qi harmony, to manifest ten thousand things principle. Thus clear bright symbolizes heaven, vast symbolizes earth, end beginning symbolizes four seasons, circling symbolizes wind rain; Five colors form pattern without chaos, eight winds follow pitch without evil, hundred measures obtain number have constant; Small large mutually complete, end beginning mutually born, lead harmony clear turbid, alternate mutually as warp. Thus music carries principles clear, ears eyes intelligent, blood qi peaceful, shift customs change habits, world all peaceful. Thus said 'music joy'. Gentleman joy gets way, small person joy gets desires. With way control desires, then joy without chaos; With desires forget way, then confused without joy. Thus gentleman returns to feeling harmonize will, broadens joy completes teaching, music carries people turn to square, can observe virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者，性之端也；

translations.literal: Virtue, nature's beginning;
translations.idiomatic: Virtue is the beginning of nature;

sentences.zh: 樂者，德之華也；

translations.literal: Music, virtue's flower;
translations.idiomatic: Music is virtue's flower;

sentences.zh: 金石絲竹，樂之器也。

translations.literal: Metal stone silk bamboo, music's instruments.
translations.idiomatic: Metal, stone, silk, bamboo—these are music's instruments.

sentences.zh: 詩，言其志也；

translations.literal: Poem, speaks will;
translations.idiomatic: Poetry speaks the will;

sentences.zh: 歌，詠其聲也；

translations.literal: Song, chants sound;
translations.idiomatic: Song chants the sound;

sentences.zh: 舞，動其容也：三者本乎心，然後樂氣從之。

translations.literal: Dance, moves appearance: three from heart, then music qi follows.
translations.idiomatic: Dance moves the appearance: these three are based in the heart, then music's qi follows.

sentences.zh: 是故情深而文明，氣盛而化神，和順積中而英華發外，唯樂不可以為偽。

translations.literal: Thus feelings deep civilized bright, qi flourishing transforms divine, harmonious yielding accumulates center brilliant flower issues outside, only music cannot be false.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when feelings are deep, they become civilized and bright; when qi is flourishing, it transforms into divine; when harmonious and yielding accumulate in the center, brilliant flowers issue outside—only music cannot be false.

translations.literal: Virtue, nature's beginning; Music, virtue's flower; Metal stone silk bamboo, music's instruments. Poem, speaks will; Song, chants sound; Dance, moves appearance: three from heart, then music qi follows. Thus feelings deep civilized bright, qi flourishing transforms divine, harmonious yielding accumulates center brilliant flower issues outside, only music cannot be false.

sentences.zh: 樂者，心之動也；

translations.literal: Music, heart's movement;
translations.idiomatic: Music is the heart's movement;

sentences.zh: 聲者，樂之象也；

translations.literal: Sound, music's image;
translations.idiomatic: Sound is music's image;

sentences.zh: 文采節奏，聲之飾也。

translations.literal: Patterns colors rhythms, sound's ornament.
translations.idiomatic: Patterns, colors, rhythms—these are sound's ornament.

sentences.zh: 君子動其本，樂其象，然後治其飾。

translations.literal: Gentleman moves root, enjoys image, then governs ornament.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman moves its root, enjoys its image, then governs its ornament.

sentences.zh: 是故先鼓以警戒，三步以見方，再始以著往，復亂以飭歸，奮疾而不拔，（也）極幽而不隱。

translations.literal: Thus first drum to warn guard, three steps to show square, twice begin to manifest going, return chaos to arrange return, rouse quick without pull, extreme dark without hide.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, first drum to warn and guard, three steps to show the square, twice begin to manifest going, return to chaos to arrange returning, rouse quickly without pulling out, reach the extreme dark without hiding.

sentences.zh: 獨樂其志，不厭其道；

translations.literal: Alone joy will, not weary way;
translations.idiomatic: Take joy alone in the will, not weary of the Way;

sentences.zh: 備舉其道，不私其欲。

translations.literal: Complete raise way, not private desires.
translations.idiomatic: Completely raise the Way, not private about desires.

sentences.zh: 是以情見而義立，樂終而德尊；

translations.literal: Thus feelings appear righteousness established, music ends virtue honored;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when feelings appear, righteousness is established; when music ends, virtue is honored;

sentences.zh: 君子以好善，小人以息過：故曰「生民之道，樂為大焉」。

translations.literal: Gentleman with love good, small person with cease faults: thus said 'born people way, music great'.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman uses it to love goodness, the small person uses it to cease faults: therefore it is said, 'Among the ways of the born people, music is the greatest.'

translations.literal: Music, heart's movement; Sound, music's image; Patterns colors rhythms, sound's ornament. Gentleman moves root, enjoys image, then governs ornament. Thus first drum to warn guard, three steps to show square, twice begin to manifest going, return chaos to arrange return, rouse quick without pull, extreme dark without hide. Alone joy will, not weary way; Complete raise way, not private desires. Thus feelings appear righteousness established, music ends virtue honored; Gentleman with love good, small person with cease faults: thus said 'born people way, music great'.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：禮樂不可以斯須去身。

translations.literal: Gentleman says: ritual music cannot moment leave body.
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman says: ritual and music cannot be separated from the body for even a moment.

sentences.zh: 致樂以治心，則易直子諒之心油然生矣。

translations.literal: Reach music to govern heart, then easy straight filial sincere heart naturally born.
translations.idiomatic: When music is brought to govern the heart, then the heart of easy straightness, filial piety, and sincerity is naturally born.

sentences.zh: 易直子諒之心生則樂，樂則安，安則久，久則天，天則神。

translations.literal: Easy straight filial sincere heart born then joy, joy then peaceful, peaceful then long, long then heaven, heaven then divine.
translations.idiomatic: When the heart of easy straightness, filial piety, and sincerity is born, then there is joy; joy then peace; peace then longevity; longevity then heaven; heaven then divinity.

sentences.zh: 天則不言而信，神則不怒而威。

translations.literal: Heaven then not speak trustworthy, divine then not angry awe.
translations.idiomatic: When heaven, then trustworthy without speaking; when divine, then awe-inspiring without anger.

sentences.zh: 致樂，以治心者也；

translations.literal: Reach music, to govern heart;
translations.idiomatic: Bringing music is for governing the heart;

sentences.zh: 致禮，以治躬者也。

translations.literal: Reach ritual, to govern person.
translations.idiomatic: Bringing ritual is for governing the person.

sentences.zh: 治躬則莊敬，莊敬則嚴威。

translations.literal: Govern person then solemn respectful, solemn respectful then strict awe.
translations.idiomatic: When governing the person, then solemn and respectful; when solemn and respectful, then strict and awe-inspiring.

sentences.zh: 心中斯須不和不樂，而鄙詐之心入之矣；

translations.literal: Heart moment not harmonious not joyful, base deceit heart enters;
translations.idiomatic: If the heart for even a moment is not harmonious and not joyful, then the heart of base deceit enters;

sentences.zh: 外貌斯須不莊不敬，而慢易之心入之矣。

translations.literal: Outside appearance moment not solemn not respectful, lazy easy heart enters.
translations.idiomatic: If the outward appearance for even a moment is not solemn and not respectful, then the heart of laziness and ease enters.

sentences.zh: 故樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.literal: Thus music, moves within;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music is that which moves within;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.literal: Ritual, moves without.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is that which moves without.

sentences.zh: 樂極和，禮極順。

translations.literal: Music extreme harmony, ritual extreme yielding.
translations.idiomatic: Music reaches its extreme in harmony; ritual reaches its extreme in yielding.

sentences.zh: 內和而外順，則民瞻其顏色而弗與爭也，望其容貌而民不生易慢焉。

translations.literal: Inner harmony outer yielding, then people gaze face not contend, look appearance people not born easy lazy.
translations.idiomatic: When inner harmony and outer yielding, then the people gaze upon their faces and do not contend with them, look upon their appearances and the people do not give rise to ease and laziness.

sentences.zh: 德煇動乎內而民莫不承聽，理發乎外而民莫不承順，故曰「知禮樂之道，舉而錯之天下無難矣」。

translations.literal: Virtue splendor moves within people none not receive hear, principle issues without people none not receive follow, thus said 'know ritual music way, raise place world no difficulty'.
translations.idiomatic: When virtue's splendor moves within, the people none do not receive and hear; when principle issues without, the people none do not receive and follow. Therefore it is said: 'Know the way of ritual and music, raise and place it in the world—there is no difficulty.'

translations.literal: Gentleman says: ritual music cannot moment leave body. Reach music to govern heart, then easy straight filial sincere heart naturally born. Easy straight filial sincere heart born then joy, joy then peaceful, peaceful then long, long then heaven, heaven then divine. Heaven then not speak trustworthy, divine then not angry awe. Reach music, to govern heart; Reach ritual, to govern person. Govern person then solemn respectful, solemn respectful then strict awe. Heart moment not harmonious not joyful, base deceit heart enters; Outside appearance moment not solemn not respectful, lazy easy heart enters. Thus music, moves within; Ritual, moves without. Music extreme harmony, ritual extreme yielding. Inner harmony outer yielding, then people gaze face not contend, look appearance people not born easy lazy. Virtue splendor moves within people none not receive hear, principle issues without people none not receive follow, thus said 'know ritual music way, raise place world no difficulty'.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.literal: Music, moves within;
translations.idiomatic: Music is that which moves within;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.literal: Ritual, moves without.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is that which moves without.

sentences.zh: 故禮主其謙，樂主其盈。

translations.literal: Thus ritual masters humility, music masters fullness.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, ritual masters humility; music masters fullness.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而進，以進為文；

translations.literal: Ritual humble advances, with advance as pattern;
translations.idiomatic: Ritual is humble and advances, taking advance as its pattern;

sentences.zh: 樂盈而反，以反為文。

translations.literal: Music full returns, with return as pattern.
translations.idiomatic: Music is full and returns, taking return as its pattern.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而不進，則銷；

translations.literal: Ritual humble not advance, then disappears;
translations.idiomatic: If ritual is humble but does not advance, then it disappears;

sentences.zh: 樂盈而不反，則放。

translations.literal: Music full not return, then abandons.
translations.idiomatic: If music is full but does not return, then it abandons.

sentences.zh: 故禮有報而樂有反。

translations.literal: Thus ritual has repay music has return.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, ritual has reciprocity; music has return.

sentences.zh: 禮得其報則樂，樂得其反則安。

translations.literal: Ritual gets repay then joy, music gets return then peaceful.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual gets its reciprocity, then joy; when music gets its return, then peace.

sentences.zh: 禮之報，樂之反，其義一也。

translations.literal: Ritual's repay, music's return, meaning one.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual's reciprocity, music's return—their meaning is one.

translations.literal: Music, moves within; Ritual, moves without. Thus ritual masters humility, music masters fullness. Ritual humble advances, with advance as pattern; Music full returns, with return as pattern. Ritual humble not advance, then disappears; Music full not return, then abandons. Thus ritual has repay music has return. Ritual gets repay then joy, music gets return then peaceful. Ritual's repay, music's return, meaning one.

sentences.zh: 夫樂者樂也，人情之所不能免也。

translations.literal: Music joy, human feelings cannot avoid.
translations.idiomatic: Now, music is joy, something that human feelings cannot avoid.

sentences.zh: 樂必發諸聲音，形於動靜，人道也。

translations.literal: Music must issue from sounds, form in movement stillness, human way.
translations.idiomatic: Music must issue from sounds, take form in movement and stillness—this is the human way.

sentences.zh: 聲音動靜，性術之變，盡於此矣。

translations.literal: Sounds movement stillness, nature method change, exhaust here.
translations.idiomatic: Sounds, movement, stillness—the changes of nature and method are exhausted here.

sentences.zh: 故人不能無樂，樂不能無形。

translations.literal: Thus people cannot lack music, music cannot lack form.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, people cannot lack music; music cannot lack form.

sentences.zh: 形而不為道，不能無亂。

translations.literal: Form without following way, cannot lack chaos.
translations.idiomatic: Form without following the Way cannot lack chaos.

sentences.zh: 先王惡其亂，故制雅頌之聲以道之，使其聲足以樂而不流，使其文足以綸而不息，使其曲直繁省廉肉節奏，足以感動人之善心而已矣，不使放心邪氣得接焉，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.literal: Former kings hated its chaos, thus formed ya song sounds to guide it, make its sounds sufficient for joy without flowing, make its patterns sufficient to bind without tiring, make its curved straight elaborate simple pure fleshy rhythms, sufficient to move people's good hearts only, not let wandering evil qi connect, this is former kings establishing music's method.
translations.idiomatic: The former kings hated its chaos, therefore they formed the sounds of ya and song to guide it, making its sounds sufficient for joy without flowing, making its patterns sufficient to bind without tiring, making its curved and straight, elaborate and simple, pure and fleshy rhythms sufficient only to move people's good hearts, not letting wandering evil qi connect—this is the method by which the former kings established music.

sentences.zh: 是故樂在宗廟之中，君臣上下同聽之，則莫不和敬；

translations.literal: Thus music in ancestral temple midst, ruler minister high low together hear it, then none not harmonious respectful;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when music is in the midst of ancestral temples, ruler and ministers, high and low together hear it, then none are not harmonious and respectful;

sentences.zh: 在族長鄉里之中，長幼同聽之，則莫不和順；

translations.literal: In clan elder village hamlet midst, elder younger together hear it, then none not harmonious yielding;
translations.idiomatic: When it is in the midst of clan elders and village hamlets, elders and young together hear it, then none are not harmonious and yielding;

sentences.zh: 在閨門之內，父子兄弟同聽之，則莫不和親。

translations.literal: In inner chambers within, father son brothers together hear it, then none not harmonious close.
translations.idiomatic: When it is within inner chambers, father and son, brothers together hear it, then none are not harmonious and close.

sentences.zh: 故樂者，審一以定和，比物以飾節，節奏合以成文，所以合和父子君臣，附親萬民也，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.literal: Thus music examines one to settle harmony, compares things to adorn sections, rhythms combine to form patterns, thus unites harmonizes father son ruler minister, attaches close ten thousand people, this is former kings establishing music's method.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music examines the one to settle harmony, compares things to adorn the sections, rhythms combine to form patterns, thus uniting and harmonizing father and son, ruler and minister, attaching and bringing close the ten thousand people—this is the method by which the former kings established music.

sentences.zh: 故聽其雅頌之聲，志意得廣焉；

translations.literal: Thus hear its ya song sounds, will intent gets broad;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, hearing its ya and song sounds, the will and intent become broad;

sentences.zh: 執其干戚，習其俯仰詘信，容貌得莊焉；

translations.literal: Grasp its shield axe, practice its bow rise bend stretch, appearance gets solemn;
translations.idiomatic: Grasping its shield and axe, practicing its bowing, rising, bending, and stretching, the appearance becomes solemn;

sentences.zh: 行其綴兆，要其節奏，行列得正焉，進退得齊焉。

translations.literal: Carry its connected ranks, grasp its rhythms, rows columns get correct, advance retreat get even.
translations.idiomatic: Carrying out its connected ranks, grasping its rhythms, the rows and columns become correct, advance and retreat become even.

sentences.zh: 故樂者天地之齊，中和之紀，人情之所不能免也。

translations.literal: Thus music is heaven earth's equal, central harmony's record, human feelings cannot avoid.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music is the equal of heaven and earth, the record of central harmony, something that human feelings cannot avoid.

translations.literal: Music joy, human feelings cannot avoid. Music must issue from sounds, form in movement stillness, human way. Sounds movement stillness, nature method change, exhaust here. Thus people cannot lack music, music cannot lack form. Form without following way, cannot lack chaos. translations.idiomatic: Those who are broad and calm, soft and correct are suitable to sing song;

sentences.zh: 廣大而靜，疏達而信者宜歌大雅；

translations.literal: Vast calm, open penetrating trustworthy suitable sing great ya;
translations.idiomatic: Those who are vast and calm, open and penetrating, trustworthy are suitable to sing the Greater Elegance.'

sentences.zh: 恭儉而好禮者宜歌小雅；

translations.literal: Respectful frugal love ritual suitable sing small ya;
translations.idiomatic: Those who are respectful and frugal and love ritual are suitable to sing the Lesser Elegance;

sentences.zh: 正直清廉而謙者宜歌風；

translations.literal: Upright pure humble suitable sing wind;
translations.idiomatic: Those who are upright and pure and humble are suitable to sing the Airs;

sentences.zh: 肆直而慈愛者宜歌商；

translations.literal: Unrestrained straight benevolent loving suitable sing shang;
translations.idiomatic: Those who are unrestrained and straight and benevolent and loving are suitable to sing shang;

sentences.zh: 溫良而能斷者宜歌齊。

translations.literal: Warm good able decide suitable sing qi.
translations.idiomatic: Those who are warm and good and able to decide are suitable to sing qi.

sentences.zh: 夫歌者，直己而陳德；

translations.literal: Song, straight self display virtue;
translations.idiomatic: Now, song straightens oneself and displays virtue;

translations.literal: Move self heaven earth respond, four seasons harmonize, stars ordered, ten thousand things nurture.
translations.idiomatic: When one moves oneself, heaven and earth respond to it; the four seasons harmonize; the stars are ordered; the ten thousand things are nurtured.

sentences.zh: 故商者，五帝之遺聲也，商人志之，故謂之商；

translations.literal: Thus shang, five emperors' remaining sound, Shang people recorded it, thus called shang;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, shang is the remaining sound of the Five Emperors; the Shang people recorded it, therefore it is called shang;

sentences.zh: 齊者，三代之遺聲也，齊人志之，故謂之齊。

translations.literal: Qi, three dynasties' remaining sound, Qi people recorded it, thus called qi.
translations.idiomatic: Qi is the remaining sound of the Three Dynasties; the Qi people recorded it, therefore it is called qi.

sentences.zh: 明乎商之詩者，臨事而屢斷；

translations.literal: Clear shang poems, face affairs repeatedly decide;
translations.idiomatic: Those who are clear about shang's poems, when facing affairs, repeatedly decide;

sentences.zh: 明乎齊之詩者，見利而讓也。

translations.literal: Clear qi poems, see benefit yield.
translations.idiomatic: Those who are clear about qi poems, when seeing benefit, yield.

sentences.zh: 臨事而屢斷，勇也；

translations.literal: Face affairs repeatedly decide, brave;
translations.idiomatic: Facing affairs and repeatedly deciding—this is bravery;

sentences.zh: 見利而讓，義也。

translations.literal: See benefit yield, righteous.
translations.idiomatic: Seeing benefit and yielding—this is righteousness.

sentences.zh: 有勇有義，非歌孰能保此？

translations.literal: Have brave have righteous, not song who can preserve this?
translations.idiomatic: Having bravery and righteousness—who but song can preserve this?

sentences.zh: 故歌之為言也，長言之也。

translations.literal: Thus song as words, long speak it.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, song as wording is to speak it at length.

sentences.zh: 說之，故言之；

translations.literal: Delight, thus speak;
translations.idiomatic: Delight in it, therefore speak it;

sentences.zh: 言之不足，故長言之；

translations.literal: Speak insufficient, thus long speak;
translations.idiomatic: Speaking is insufficient, therefore speak it at length;

sentences.zh: 長言之不足，故嗟嘆之；

translations.literal: Long speak insufficient, thus sigh lament;
translations.idiomatic: Speaking at length is insufficient, therefore sigh and lament it;

translations.literal: Thus Shun played five string qin, sang southern wind poem world governed;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, Shun played his five-string qin and sang the poem of the Southern Wind, and the world was governed;

translations.idiomatic: Zhou made the sounds of Zhao Ge and the northern rustics, and his body died and state perished.

sentences.zh: 舜之道何弘也？

translations.literal: Shun's way how broad?
translations.idiomatic: How broad is Shun's way?

sentences.zh: 紂之道何隘也？

translations.literal: Zhou's way how narrow?
translations.idiomatic: How narrow is Zhou's way?

sentences.zh: 夫南風之詩者生長之音也，舜樂好之，樂與天地同意，得萬國之驩心，故天下治也。

translations.literal: Southern wind poem growing sound, Shun joy liked it, joy with heaven earth same intent, got ten thousand states happy hearts, thus world governed.
translations.idiomatic: Now, the poem of the Southern Wind is the sound of growth; Shun delighted in it and liked it; his delight shared the same intent as heaven and earth, obtaining the happy hearts of the ten thousand states, therefore the world was governed.

translations.idiomatic: At midnight he heard the sound of drum and qin; he asked those on left and right, and all answered, 'Not heard.'

translations.literal: Former Huang Di with great united ghosts spirits, now lord virtue righteousness thin, insufficient listen, listen will defeat.'
translations.idiomatic: In former times, the Yellow Emperor united ghosts and spirits with the great music; now my lord's virtue and righteousness are thin, insufficient to listen to it; listening to it will bring defeat.'

sentences.zh: 平公曰：「寡人老矣，所好者音也，願遂聞之。」

translations.literal: Ping Gong said: 'I old, like sound, wish continue hear.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping said: 'I am old; what I like is the sound; I wish to continue hearing it.'

sentences.zh: 師曠不得已，援琴而鼓之。

translations.literal: Shi Kuang had no choice, drew qin drummed it.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Kuang had no choice but to take up the qin and play it.

sentences.zh: 一奏之，有白雲從西北起；

translations.literal: One play, had white clouds from northwest rise;
translations.idiomatic: When he played it once, there were white clouds rising from the northwest;

sentences.zh: 再奏之，大風至而雨隨之，飛廊瓦，左右皆奔走。

translations.literal: Twice play, great wind arrived rain followed, flew corridor tiles, left right all fled.
translations.idiomatic: When he played it twice, a great wind arrived and rain followed it, flying the corridor tiles; those on left and right all fled.

sentences.zh: 平公恐懼，伏於廊屋之閒。

translations.literal: Ping Gong feared, hid corridor house between.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping was fearful and hid between the corridor and the house.

sentences.zh: 晉國大旱，赤地三年。

translations.literal: Jin state great drought, red earth three years.
translations.idiomatic: Jin state had a great drought; the earth was red for three years.

translations.literal: Ping Gong greatly happy, rose gave Shi Kuang toast. Returned sat, asked: 'Sound none more sorrowful?' Shi Kuang said: 'Has. Former Huang Di with great united ghosts spirits, now lord virtue righteousness thin, insufficient listen, listen will defeat.' Ping Gong said: 'I old, like sound, wish continue hear.' Shi Kuang had no choice, drew qin drummed it. One play, had white clouds from northwest rise; Twice play, great wind arrived rain followed, flew corridor tiles, left right all fled. Ping Gong feared, hid corridor house between. Jin state great drought, red earth three years.

sentences.zh: 聽者或吉或凶。

translations.literal: Listeners sometimes auspicious sometimes inauspicious.
translations.idiomatic: For those who listened, some were auspicious and some inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 夫樂不可妄興也。

translations.literal: Music cannot recklessly arise.
translations.idiomatic: Music cannot be recklessly performed.

translations.literal: Listeners sometimes auspicious sometimes inauspicious. Music cannot recklessly arise.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：夫上古明王舉樂者，非以娛心自樂，快意恣欲，將欲為治也。

translations.literal: Grand Historian says: Upper ancient enlightened kings raised music, not to entertain heart self joy, satisfy intent indulge desires, will want govern.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: The enlightened kings of high antiquity who performed music did not do so to entertain their hearts and take joy for themselves, to satisfy their intentions and indulge their desires—they wished to govern.

sentences.zh: 正教者皆始於音，音正而行正。

translations.literal: Correct teaching all begin sound, sound correct conduct correct.
translations.idiomatic: Correct teachings all begin with sound; when sound is correct, conduct is correct.

sentences.zh: 故音樂者，所以動蕩血脈，通流精神而和正心也。

translations.literal: Thus music, to move shake blood vessels, connect flow spirit harmonize correct heart.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music serves to move and shake the blood vessels, connect and flow the spirit, and harmonize and correct the heart.

sentences.zh: 故宮動脾而和正聖，商動肺而和正義，角動肝而和正仁，徵動心而和正禮，羽動腎而和正智。

translations.literal: Thus gong moves spleen harmonize correct sage, shang moves lung harmonize correct righteousness, jue moves liver harmonize correct benevolence, zhi moves heart harmonize correct ritual, yu moves kidney harmonize correct wisdom.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, gong moves the spleen and harmonizes and corrects sagehood; shang moves the lung and harmonizes and corrects righteousness; jue moves the liver and harmonizes and corrects benevolence; zhi moves the heart and harmonizes and corrects ritual; yu moves the kidney and harmonizes and corrects wisdom.

sentences.zh: 故樂所以內輔正心而外異貴賤也；

translations.literal: Thus music to inner aid correct heart outer distinguish noble base;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music serves to internally aid in correcting the heart and externally distinguish noble and base;

sentences.zh: 上以事宗廟，下以變化黎庶也。

translations.literal: Above serve ancestral temple, below transform common people.
translations.idiomatic: Above, to serve the ancestral temples; below, to transform the common people.

sentences.zh: 琴長八尺一寸，正度也。

translations.literal: Qin long eight chi one cun, correct measure.
translations.idiomatic: The qin is eight chi one cun long—this is the correct measure.

sentences.zh: 弦大者為宮，而居中央，君也。

translations.literal: Strings large gong, reside central, ruler.
translations.idiomatic: The largest string is gong and resides in the center—it is the ruler.

sentences.zh: 商張右傍，其餘大小相次，不失其次序，則君臣之位正矣。

translations.literal: Shang stretched right side, remaining large small follow order, not lose order, then ruler minister positions correct.
translations.idiomatic: Shang is stretched on the right side; the rest, large and small, follow in order without losing their sequence—then the positions of ruler and minister are correct.

sentences.zh: 故聞宮音，使人溫舒而廣大；

translations.literal: Thus hear gong sound, make people warm comfortable broad;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, hearing gong sound makes people warm, comfortable, and broad;

sentences.zh: 聞商音，使人方正而好義；

translations.literal: Hear shang sound, make people square correct love righteousness;
translations.idiomatic: Hearing shang sound makes people square, correct, and loving of righteousness;

sentences.zh: 聞角音，使人惻隱而愛人；

translations.literal: Hear jue sound, make people compassionate love people;
translations.idiomatic: Hearing jue sound makes people compassionate and loving of people;

sentences.zh: 聞徵音，使人樂善而好施；

translations.literal: Hear zhi sound, make people joy good give;
translations.idiomatic: Hearing zhi sound makes people joyful of goodness and fond of giving;

sentences.zh: 聞羽音，使人整齊而好禮。

translations.literal: Hear yu sound, make people orderly love ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Hearing yu sound makes people orderly and loving of ritual.

sentences.zh: 夫禮由外入，樂自內出。

translations.literal: Ritual from outside enter, music from inside out.
translations.idiomatic: Ritual enters from outside; music emerges from within.

sentences.zh: 故君子不可須臾離禮，須臾離禮則暴慢之行窮外；

translations.literal: Thus gentleman cannot moment leave ritual, moment leave ritual then violent lazy conduct exhaust outside;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the gentleman cannot be separated from ritual for even a moment; if separated from ritual for a moment, then violent and lazy conduct exhausts the outside;

sentences.zh: 不可須臾離樂，須臾離樂則姦邪之行窮內。

translations.literal: Cannot moment leave music, moment leave music then evil crooked conduct exhaust inside.
translations.idiomatic: Cannot be separated from music for even a moment; if separated from music for a moment, then evil and crooked conduct exhausts the inside.

sentences.zh: 故樂音者，君子之所養義也。

translations.literal: Thus music sound, gentleman nourish righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, music sound is what the gentleman nourishes righteousness with.

sentences.zh: 夫古者，天子諸侯聽鐘磬未嘗離於庭，卿大夫聽琴瑟之音未嘗離於前，所以養行義而防淫佚也。

translations.literal: Ancient, Son of Heaven feudal lords listen bells chimes never left court, ministers officials listen qin se sound never left front, thus nourish conduct righteousness guard licentious dissipation.
translations.idiomatic: In ancient times, the Son of Heaven and feudal lords listened to bells and chimes without ever leaving the court; ministers and officials listened to qin and se sounds without ever leaving the front—this was to nourish conduct and righteousness and guard against licentious dissipation.

sentences.zh: 夫淫佚生於無禮，故聖王使人耳聞雅頌之音，目視威儀之禮，足行恭敬之容，口言仁義之道。

translations.literal: Licentious dissipation born from no ritual, thus sage kings make people ears hear ya song sounds, eyes see majestic ceremony ritual, feet walk respectful appearance, mouth speak benevolence righteousness way.
translations.idiomatic: Licentious dissipation is born from lack of ritual; therefore, sage kings cause people's ears to hear ya and song sounds, eyes to see the majestic ceremonies of ritual, feet to walk with respectful appearance, mouths to speak the way of benevolence and righteousness.

sentences.zh: 故君子終日言而邪辟無由入也。

translations.literal: Thus gentleman all day speak evil crooked no way enter.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, the gentleman speaks all day long and evil and crookedness have no way to enter.
